author: {'steamid': '76561197975245779', 'num_games_owned': 2093, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1551683806}
review:
This game is great. Great atmosphere and challenging puzzles. The one thing that bugged me was a particular puzzle where you have to use an inventory item on your character instead of using it on the "enemy" (not really an enemy but close enough).  It is extremely obvious what anyone on earth would want to happen were they to use the item on the "enemy." It is extremely obvious that you wouldn't want to throw it at it. Some might call this a little extra layer of difficulty. I call it very cheap. The only reason that one annoyed me for so long really is it had me stuck for too long when it should have just worked.

Anyway one puzzle blunder certainly doesn't ruin a fantastic game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053880399', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1509, 'last_played': 1551015301}
review:
[h1]Özet[/h1]

NES konsoluna çıkan 1984 yapımı Shadowgate'in yeniden yapımı harika bir işaretle ve tıkla, macera bulmaca oyunudur. Yeniden yapım denilse de aslında bayağı farklı bir oyun. Bulmacalarda büyük bir değişim söz konusu. Özellikle oyunu oynadığınız zorluğa göre oyunun içindeki bulmacaların çözümlerindeki ufak tefek değişimler ve yüksek zorlukta bulunabilen bir sürü gizlilik ile onları keşfetmesi hoş hissettiriyor. Yüksek zorluktaki zaman kısıtlamalarını rahatsız edici bulabilir ve NES versiyonunu oynamış oyuncular belki memnun olmayabilir. Ben yinede farklı bir tat olarak öneriyorum.

[h1]Çok fazla isim barındıran, derin gibi gözüken kısa senaryo[/h1]

Karakterimiz, basit bir Windemere askeri olan genç Jair Cuthegar'dir. Rüyasında tanımadığı Lakmir adında bir büyücünün, onu büyük bir tehlikeye karşı uyarması ve onu çağırmasıyla kuzeye, yaşayan kale Shadowgate'e doğru yola çıkar. Kalenin girişinde, maceramızda bize eşlik edecek ve yardım isteyebileceğimiz veya pataklayabileceğimiz kurukafa Yorick'i yanımıza alıyor ve kaleye giriş yapıyoruz. Rüyamızda söylenen tehlikeyle kaleye attığımız ilk adımımızla karşılaşıyoruz. Talimar The Black adında kötü büyücü, kırmızı bir sisin içinde bize sesleniyor. Lakmir ve on iki büyücünün dahi onu durduramadığını, basit bir askerin beni nasıl durdurabileceği gibi alaycı sözlerle "Yapabiliyorsan gel yap!" diyerek bize meydan okuyor. (SEN KİM KÖPEK!?) Shadowgate Kalesinde kısa bir keşiften sonra Lakmir'in bıraktığı notlar ve büyülü taşlar sayesinde amacımızı öğreniyoruz. Kalenin derinlerinde hapsedilmiş kudretli varlığı Talimar uyandırıp gücünü elde etmeden önce onu yok etmek.

Senaryomuz bu kadar. Oyun içerisinde bolca parşömen, kitap ve duvar yazısı okuyarak Shadowgate evreniyle alakalı birçok minik bilgi öğreniyoruz. Bu durum senaryoya derinlik katsa da bazen çok isim olması bulmacalarda kafa karıştırabiliyor. Yazıların büyük bir çoğunluğu ise ekstra bilgi olduğunu da ekleyeyim.

[h1]Oynanış, zorluk seviyeleri ve bulmacalar![/h1]

Oyunda toplam dokuz adet eylem seçeneğimiz var. Look, Take, Open, Close, Go, Use, Hit, Eat ve Speak. Bir objenin üstüne tıkladığınızda çember halinde 9 eylem çıkıyor ve yapmak istediğiniz eylemi tıklayarak seçiyorsunuz. Eğer isterseniz NES konsolundaki gibi ilk önce eylem, sonra obje, son olarak etkileşime geçilecek ikinci objeyi seçerek birazcık nostaljik tatta da oynayabiliyorsunuz. Bu seçenekte eylemlerin hepsi ekranın üstünde gözüküyor. Bu haliyle oynamanız oyunun bir kaç ekstra gizli eylemi gerçekleştirmenize de izin veriyor. Sağ tık yaparak eylemden vazgeçiyorsunuz. Tüm bu fare ile kullanılan eylemler dışında klavyeden hızlıca kullanabilmek için atanmış kısa yollar mevcut. Eşyaya tıklayıp CTRL basılı tutup sayıya tıkladığınızda o eşyaya kısa yol atıyorsunuz. Kısa yola atanmış eşya için "Use" eylemini hızlıca kullanabiliyorsunuz. Eşya çantamızda kullanılabilir , okunabilir , giyilebilir eşyalar ve büyüler olarak ayarlanmış dört tane sekmeyle güzel bir rahatlık sağlanmış.

Gelelim oyunun zorluklarına. Normal ve Classic olmak üzere iki tür zorluk bulunuyor. Normal, bu türü ilk defa deneyenler için düşünülmüş. Zaman kısıtlamaları yok. Bulmacalar çok zorlayıcı değil. Gereksiz eşya alımlarına izin verilmiyor. Gereksiz eylemlere izin verilmiyor. Mesela ateşle konuşmaya çalışmak ya da kalkanı yemeye çalışmak gibi. Tehlikeli eylemlere de izin verilmiyor. Mesela önemli parşömenleri ateşe vermek veya pencereden atlamak gibi ölümle sonuçlanacak eylemlere. Bazı tehlikeli eylemler içinse "Emin misin?" şeklinde uyarı yaparak söylüyor. Eylemi yapabiliyorsunuz ama yapmamanız önerilir, tünelin ucunda Mahmut Hoca var. Gayet tadımlık, bir sefer böyle oynayıp bitirmeniz ve oyunu kavramanız önerilir.

Classic zorluk türü altında Apprentice, Journaymen ve Master adında üç zorluk seviyesi bulunuyor. Apprentice ve Journaymen, zaman kısıtlamaları bulunan, Normal'in çoğu kısıtlaması kaldırılmış, bazı bulmacaların ipuçları değiştirilmiş ve yeni odalar eklenmiş hali.

Zaman Kısıtlamaları ise şunlar: Meşale, Banshee Laneti ve Talimar. Oyunda sınırlı sayıda meşale bulunuyor ve "Look" eylemi dışında yapacağınız her eylem, meşalenin azalmasına sebep oluyor. Apprentice ve Journaymen'de meşale kıtlığı yaşanmıyor ama Master'da su gibi gidiyor. Yine de üç zorluk içinde bol bol kayıt ve kayıttan yükleme yaparak, zamanla çözdüğünüz veya yaptığınız eylemleri geri alarak en az hamlede tekrarlamanız önerilir. Banshee Laneti ise meşale gibi eylem yaptıkça geri sayımı olan bir lanet. Çözümü Apprentice ve Journaymen'de çok kolay olsa da çözümün olduğu yere kadar kısa sürede gelmek çok önemli. Master'da ise çözümü hem zor hem de birden fazla alternatifi var ve zaman çok daha kısa. Talimar kısıtlaması ise Master'da dahi 2000 hamle sayısını geçmediğiniz müddetçe yaşamayacağınız bir kısıtlama. Fakat [spoiler] oyunun sonundaki kurukafa kapıyı açarsanız oyun size 20-30 hamlelik kısıtlama getiriyor ve gerekli eşyalar yoksa ne içeri girip oyunu bitirebiliyorsunuz ne de 20-30 hamlede eşyaları alıp tekrardan kapıya girebiliyorsunuz. [/spoiler] Hazırlığınızı yaptığınıza emin olun.

Oyunun en güzel kısmı Master zorluk! Meşaleler çok hızlı tükeniyor, Banshee lanetini daha az hamlede çözmeniz gerekiyor. Çoğu obje, eşyanın yeri ve olan bulmacaların çözüm yolları değiştirilmiş. Yeni büyüler, yeni odalar, yeni bulmacalar, yeni engeller konmuş ve birçok ekstra gizlilik eklenmiş. Apprentice ve Journaymen'de olan ve girilmeyen odaların hepsine girilebiliyor. Master'da tüm kısıtlamalar kalktığı için yapacağınız hamlelere dikkat etmelisiniz. Parşömenleri yakmak gibi hamleler hiç uyarı vermeksizin gerçekleşiyor. Yanlışlıkla büyü parşömeni yakarsanız oyunda tamamen tıkanabilirsiniz. Kendinizi istediğiniz gibi öldürebilir hatta oyunda gizli ölüm şekillerini bile bulabilirsiniz. Master'ın bulmacaları zorladığı kadar çok fazla gizlilik barındırması benim en sevdiğim kısım. Tabi aniden çıkan engelleri o an karar verip çözmekte heyecan veren yanlarından biri. Zaman kısıtlamalarını kayıt ve kayıttan yükle ile bir miktar geciktirip tüm bu baskının altında oyunu bitirmenin keyfi apayrı ama herkesin katlanıp, sevebileceğini sanmıyorum.

Bulmacalar genellikle eşyaları doğru biçimde yerleştirmek veya o an için gerekli eşyayı kullanmaktan ibaret. El becerisi isteyen bulmacalar yok ama ipuçlarını anlamak İngilizce istiyor. Bu oyunun güzel olduğu kısım not tutmak ve çözümleri karşımıza çıkan ekranda aramakta. Bazı ipuçları gözünüzün önünde olsa da göremeyebilirsiniz. Bazen lüzumsuz gözüken detay aslında işinize yarayabilir. Bu durumlara özellikle Master zorluğunda dikkat ediniz. 

[h1]Kısaca görseller, müzik, minik birkaç sorun ve değerlendirme.[/h1]

Görseller muazzam. Senaryo anlatımında ara sahneler ve mekân tasarımları detaylarıyla muhteşem gözüküyor. Eşya etkileşimleriyle de hiç bir sıkıntı yaşanmıyor, bazı objeler ne kadar küçük gözüküyor olsada. Etkileşime geçilebilecek eşyaları görmek için "F2" tuşuna basarak parlamalarını sağlayabilirsiniz, hoş bir detay. Müzikler, NES dönemindeki müziklerin gayet güzelce uyarlanmış versiyonları. NES'deki versiyonlarını dinleyebilir veya yeni hallerini dinleyebilirsiniz. NES versiyonu müzikler oynarken rahatsız edici olabiliyor ama yeni versiyonları gayet hafif tonlarda, dikkat dağıtmayan güzel parçalar. Seslendirmeler az olsa da seslendiren yaşlı amcaların sesleri harika.

Minik sorunlardan birincisi; Master zorluğunda anahtar gibi eşyalar kullanıldıktan sonra eşya çantasından çıkmıyor. Eşya çantası düzenleme seçeneği olmadığı için bir noktadan sonra çok fazla eşya dolup karmaşa yaratıyorlar. Minik sorunlardan ikincisi; çok fazla lüzumsuz eşya toplanabiliyor ama eşyalardan elden çıkarılmıyor. Eşya çantası dolup taşıyor gene. Minik sorunlardan üçüncüsü; oyunda bolca silah topluyoruz ama beceri odaklı bulmacalar olmadığı için silah kullanmanın tadını çıkaramıyoruz. Üzücü. Bir sonraki oyun Beyond Shadowgate'i merakla bekliyorum bakalım. Gizli bulmacaları seven herkese önerilir.

[b]Puanım 75/100[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198256161774', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1548758335}
review:
Un point n' click à l'ancienne : Une interface vraiment pas ergonomique et des énigmes narratives peu intuitives.
Faut aimer faire trois fois le tour du château pour trouver le pauvre truc caché à l'endroit où jamais t'aurais cherché.
Heureusement que Yarik est là pour donner des conseils, et se prendre des pins quand il balance des blagues pourries.
Le style fait penser à un livre dont vous êtes le héros avec des images en support.
Bon j'ai pas trouvé ce jeu super nul, mais j'ai pas pris un énorme kif non plus. Franchement 15 balles, ça fait lourd.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035475928', 'num_games_owned': 631, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1546386277}
review:
Nice game, especially if you have played the NES classic. It has a really cool art (which in my case is really stimulating to create some nice little artworks), a soundtrack which is ok but really tickles your nerves when the torch is burning out, and some really nice puzzles.
I understand that it's not for everyone because it's reaaaaally easy to die in this game, it's like a dark soul-point&click and sometime it's really near-impossible to know how to find the next thing you've got to do (and that obviusly led you to peek at some walkthrought and that really ruins the experience).
Anyway fun game that I just devoured in one sitting.
7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198022305964', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1586050370}
review:
This game is brilliant. From the artwork, to the puzzles, it is THE best Shadowgate title since the original NES version. Lots of love in this. In fact, I think it elevated & superseded the original. Well worth the money.

This modern version is way longer, has way more inventory, lots of puzzles, multiple difficulty levels, nods to the original, and a "retro version" of itself. And yes, it is difficult ... I'm a veteran gamer and had to start this on easy!!

Two thumbs up all the way.

Now if they'll do ones for Uninvited, Deja Vu, and that other one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121954957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1544224797}
review: Una versión renovada del original de 1987, un juego increíble, con una historia que atrapa, puzzles ingeniosos, una aventura gráfica como las de antes. Bien traducido al castellano y una banda sonora que acompaña. El juego es difícil, no es como otros que te llevan de la mano, aquí vas a tener que exprimirte el coco y dar muchas vueltas buscando una posible solución. Además, si tomas malas decisiones puedes morir fácilmente. Un juego totalmente recomendable, y más a los 3€ que lo he pillado de oferta. Ni te lo pienses.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987392802', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1657460942}

author: {'steamid': '76561198011951484', 'num_games_owned': 569, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1545485618}
review:
This is a remake of the original 1987 adventure game for the Apple Macintosh.  The name of the game alone, spoke to me of prestige and nostalgia, and also mystery (I never played any of the games in the Shadowgate series).  The modernized look of the game is spectacular, oozing classic style and poignant colors.  A large part of what hooked me into the game was the art direction.  The soundtrack is also alluring.  Here is a game for you if the classic feels appeal to you.  

There is a very foundational structure inherent in the point-and-click adventure genre for the entire gaming industry in general - the remake exudes this sense of being seminal from the original.  Playing this game practically made me feel like I jumped back in time, except I didn't...  the game jumped through time to this modern remake and made the past available.  Together with the past, the game builds a whole world with its own lore, intrique, mysteries...  I still feel the game as a living world, after finishing it...  But let's get to it: the surface appeal of Shadowgate lies in its classic roots, artful visuals, and the cool OST.

Then there are the puzzles.  This update to the original Shadowgate is 95% new puzzles.  And I can say that the puzzles are good.  Well, I don't think I can say that; afterall, I've only finished the game on its easiest difficulty...  I finished the game on normal mode, which is the Novice level.  There are four difficulty levels in the game, Normal (aka Novice), which is it's own level and then Classic which is split into three levels, Journeyman, Adept, and Master.  Classic mode can be played Ironman, which means no saves.  

You might think that, for a point-and-click adventure game, there would be no differences in difficulty levels...  This remake of Shadowgate is different however.  The higher up the difficulty the more complex the puzzles will become, and the easiser it will get to be killed.  I found that being able to die in an adventure game made the genre fresh to me again.  And it's satisfying to know that there will be more difficult puzzles awaiting if you wanted to play through the game with a higher difficulty.  

The puzzles are all sensible and even the ones that are so difficult that I had to resort to a walkthrough (I think I looked up solutions three times during my Novice run?), even those puzzles would make sense and make you think, "dang, I should have gotten it on my own!).  

So there, I laid out for you the reasons to get Shadowgate.  
-it's a remake of a classic, and a quality remake
-the art and music of the game has a classic and stylish appeal
-the puzzles are satisfying and make their own logic sensible
-death is possible, and different difficulties require more complex reasoning

I wanted to complain about getting stuck and being made to stare at the screen for hours...  but that is only because I was stubborn.  There is a hint system in the game that doesn't give much away, and it does its job.  You can turn this off if you like.

Edit: 
I was mistaken in the past about a feature that I thought wasn't in the game, but it is.  I said before that the only negative I had with the game was that I couldn't play it in its original graphics as an option.  I was wrong.  There is a "Retro Mode" available in the game as an option.  From the Steam game "about this game" section: "Retro Mode: Play the game like it's 1989!  Toggle on pixelated graphics, listen to Hiroyuki Masuno's original NES chip tunes, move between rooms with NES transitions, and enjoy the text in retro format."

author: {'steamid': '76561198014818669', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1607657547}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985946262', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1538950427}
review:
The memories and emotions this game brings back is almost overwhelming.  My dad's best friend, whom I referred to as "Uncle Dan", introduced me to this game.  Uncle Dan was a nerd before nerds were a thing.  He helped make me maps in Zelda 2, he gave me his copy of Shadowgate after hyping me up about it for weeks, and moreover he was a great friend.
Unfortunately, he suddenly passed away when I was about 13.

I still remember the day he gifted me Shadowgate (I still own the cartridge)... and he refused to help me with it.  He forced me to figure the puzzle out.  I finally beat it, and I felt so goddamn good.

This remake is incredible.  It's nostalgic, while bringing new puzzles into the mix.  The moment I started reading the "Five to find..." line, my lips moved along with it, as if it were a part of me.

To those out there who are hesitant, this is a point-and-click adventure (similar to Myst) with the potential that you will be forced to restart from square-1.  However, if you restart, you know the puzzle ahead of you, so the replay value of this game is quite limited.

If you are a fan of the old NES/GB Shadowgate or if you enjoy point-and-click adventure/puzzlers, this is worth full price.  

If you haven't heard of this game before or aren't sure on the genre, wait for a sale, and pick it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002252866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 526, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1536086914}
review:
[h1] 即死系古典アドベンチャーをリメイク [/h1]

あの伝説の！
といいたいところだが、リアルでファミコン版を触ったことがあるおっさん世代なので、もはや昔すぎて当時の記憶が定かではない。

うーん。
たぶん、それなりに忠実なリメイクなのでしょう。

ゲームとしては、比較的単純なポイント＆クリックのアドベンチャー。
現代人向けにヌルい難易度のモードが用意されており、理不尽な突然死（本作最大の魅力といえばそれまでだが）が軽減されるなど、かなりプレイアブルになっているようだ。

英語はそれなりに面倒くさく、カットシーンについていくのは割と大変。
テキストの分量もあるので、そのあたりじっくり取り組む覚悟は必要かもしれない。

- only the main storyline is voiced, rest of the interactions or dialogue is written text.
- scheint, dass es einige Fehler in der Übersetzung gibt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198372747910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 2218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1408, 'last_played': 1573429809}
review:
I've played the original game, on the NES, countless times when I was young. I have very fond memories of that game; being bested by the many puzzles, dieing over and over in unneccesary and gruesome ways, while still enjoying exploring the castle and listening to the great soundtrack.
This remake has pretty much all of that, and more.
There are 4 distinct difficulties now, each with their own sets of items you can find and use, different rooms to explore and the puzzles are either different or more complex.
So the game has a lot of replay value, especially if you want to get all the achievements. There are a LOT of them.
To some, this game may seem unfair since there are 'time limits', but honestly they are not too bad. And even if you do happen to somehow run out of time (in actuality it's a number of actions you're allowed to perform), you can always load an earlier save or play a lot more efficient on your next playthrough.
The remake has everything that made the original game fantastic and adds even more deaths, some great voice acting, a grisly and yet charming art style, new spells and a LOT of new puzzles and items.
Liked the original and want a new twist on it? Go play this and you'll love it!
Fan of point-and-click games but don't like time limits or restrictions? Just play it on 'normal' (easiest difficulty) first. You get almost 5000 turns to finish the game. That's more than enough to get used to the game.
You can then decide if you want to challenge yourself with a harder game or not.
In any case, I highly recommend this game. I had an absolute blast playing it numerous times to get everything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047455579', 'num_games_owned': 2682, 'num_reviews': 1289, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1521419469}

author: {'steamid': '76561198208843460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 573, 'last_played': 1521366274}
review:
This is an enjoyable remake of a classic game- not played the original but impressed with this version. Has different difficulty settings and help you can use or not use so quite a range of difficulty levels so you can find one that suits.

Very addictive- I wanted to reach the end and couldn't leave so finished it in a night (still about 9 hours with bonus side quest- on easier setting so suspect on harder settings I'd not have done it one session, the map hints at some nice extras on the tougher settings too as well as maybe not being able to explore everywhere in easy mode, so may be good for a replay if you've played easy first.)

Only a few places you can die and if you save often this isn't too problematic- nor is the timed element (which may just be part of one of the puzzles anyway- I didn't fail because of the timed element so don't worry about reviews implying you have to do it to a timer, either there isn't really one or it's a long one, and you have to trigger it anyway, it's just something finding an object resolves.) Even if you do die it takes you back to soon before, you don't usually have too many steps to retrace.

Had a lot of fun playing the game, exploring and solving the puzzles.

The side quest 'easter egg' is very brief and slightly pointless but a small trivial bit of fun nonetheless.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123658289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1515474720}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970773304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1577306829}
review:
First things first:
Bought this off a discount for like 3€ - totally worth it.

Fun and relaxed game of exploring a fantasy castle old school RPG style. 

Playstyle:
I have'nt played the original - but im a 90's nostalgia type in general, so im familiar with this kind of RPG and how the atmosphere is created and the story unfolds. The remake catches this feeling very well by just leaving the gameplay where it is: You progress through the castle room by room, pick up stuff, use it,[spoiler] an die ;)[/spoiler] like so many RPG Novels you might know from that period (without the need of seeking pages all the time). No leveling up and attribute points here - just inventory (includes spells). There are no swordfighting minigames or stuff like that - you decide how you want to encounter an enemy when he shows up and then you get the result straight away: [spoiler]ur ded again ;D[/spoiler]. There is however a limit to the actions you can do, before the game ends and [spoiler]take a guess...[/spoiler]. But so what? you start over again, with all the things you learned, and its fine, nice touch to the game actually. When you tune it down to "normal" aka casual, the limit wont hit you too soon.

Other Stuff:
Graphics are decent, just animated 2D stuff - no showoff 3D. Sounds get the job done. Soundtrack is nice and fits the atmosphere.
The UI has some flaws, could have been better. I'd like to have icons for the spells directly on the screen, so i wouldn't need to open my inventory all the time. It comes with a built in hint-system you can turn off, thats nice.

nice game, would by again for 3€. maybe 5€ too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198417590094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1226, 'last_played': 1511020615}
review:
The game design and the environment are astonishingly gorgeous.

But the adventure itself is not that intuitive or intriguing as the player would get a lot of useless trash items and 'CURSE' which limits turns (actions) you can have unless you cure yourself in time, which means if you cannot it'll ruin entire game progress so far.

But it has 'difficulty options' and each level is well arranged so if you are a big classic adventure game fan or enjoy some challenging games, I would recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039829847', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1602001113}
review:
I really loved playing Shadowgate on my NES back in the day, so I mentioned to a friend that I wanted to check this game out and he bought it for me. It is nice to see that someone took some care and remastered this. It has very nice 'guild wars' type graphics which lends itself really well to a point and click adventure. 

So far I have enjoyed this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999921146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 423, 'playtime_forever': 2277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1414, 'last_played': 1515158706}
review:
Un jeu d'Aventure Point & Clik un peu particulier mais clairement intéressant pour les habitués du genre car il a un "style" clairement à part.

Ici la "mort" fait partie intégrante du GamePlay puisque vous incarnez un héro évoluant dans un univers médiéval fantastique, un peu comme dans un roman "dont vous êtes le héro".

Les tableaux sont statiques avec quelques animations et de nombreux bruitages. Le tout est très bien réalisé, agréable à l'oeil et à l'oreille. Le peu de voix est un anglais mais tous les textes sont traduits en fançais (à quelques fautes près comme l'article "the" qui apparait régulièrement).

J'ai commencé en Mode "normal" pour me familiariser et l'aventure c'est relativement bien faite d'autant que beaucoup de choses sont là pour vous aider au démarrage, l'interface n'est pas des plus ergonomique mais on s'y fait et on prend rapidement ses marques. Les raccourçis claviers facilitent la vie notamment. Chose surprenante, même si j'ai "rushé" une seconde fois en mode Classique/Apprenti (facile), les quelques changements apportent quelques nouveautés auquelles on doit s'adapter. En mode Classique/Compagnon, vous avez accès à de nouvelles pièces... Cette construction particulière est intéressante mais diablement... enervante car ce qui marchait le coup d'avant... ne fonctionne pas toujours entièrement de la même manière, celà rajoute encore de la difficulté qui est globalement déjà bien présente.

Beaucoup d'éléments rendent cette aventure vivante (anxiogène ?) : la gestion de la lumière avec les torches qui s'usent, les combats et autres pièges mortels, les limites de temps (surtout aux deux derniers modes). On peut aussi choisir de s'équiper de certains équipements, très utile pour certaines quêtes. Et pour finir, beaucoup de choses ne servent à rien, ou tout du moins pas pour l'aventure principale... ce qui corse le tout.

Un jeu à ne pas mettre entre toutes les mains aux difficultés élevée (nécécité d'une certaine pugnacité) mais qui peut convenir aux aventuriers en herbe aux deux premières difficultés. Un Remake/Remaster vraiment, vraiment réussi. Bravo !

J'ai l'impression, vu la qualité de l'évolution des énigmes, que ce jeu a été conçu pour que l'on teste au moins les 3 difficultés du mode "classique". A noter l'existence d'un mode "homme de fer" pour les plus téméraires.

author: {'steamid': '76561198300270231', 'num_games_owned': 5385, 'num_reviews': 894, 'playtime_forever': 4294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3373, 'last_played': 1514365767}
review:
⠀[b]《그림자문》[/b], 이 게임은 제가 지금까지 해본 그 어떤 '포인트&클릭' 장르 중에서도 단연 독보적인 플레이 타임을 보유하고 있는 제품이라 확신합니다. 스토리가 대서사시 뺨 칠 만큼 길어서 그렇냐고요? 하하, 그건 아닙니다. 분명 엔딩을 보는 거 자체는 다른 게임들과 비슷한 시간 투자로 가능하죠. 하지만 도전과제, 으, 맞아요. 도전과제가 터무니 없이 비효율적인 게 문제죠. 

⠀회차반복을 몇 번이나 하는지 모르겠어요. 그걸로 끝이 아닙니다. 수집이라는 노가다 시스템 또한 존재하죠. 저는 당신이 이 게임을 꼭 '가이드' 를 보고 하시는 걸 추천합니다. 홀로 해결했을 때의 성취감? 개나 줘버리십시오. 그런 거 느낄 새도 없이 스트레스로 인해 게임을 꺼버리는 게 먼저일 테니까요. 

⠀일단 이 게임은 다른 포인트&클릭 장르에 비해 인터페이스가 복잡한 편입니다. 텍스트도 만만치 않게 많죠. 1회차를 하고 있다면, 맵도 거의 출구 없는 미궁 마냥 느껴지실 겁니다. 설상가상으로 영어실력까지 부족하면? 게임오버. 홀로 엔딩 볼 생각은 접으시는 게 좋습니다. 도전과제까지 노린다면 더욱 말할 것도 없죠. 가이드를 보고, 엔딩을 보고, 맵에 익숙해지십시오. 그것이 긴 장문의 텍스트를 읽기 싫어하는 유저에게는 첫걸음입니다. 난이도를 높이고 아이언 모드를 추가하면서 2회차, 3회차, 4회차를 하다 보면[i]ㅡ도전과제를 올클리어하기 위해서는 이 과정을 필히 거쳐야할 겁니다ㅡ[/i] 눈을 감고도 머릿속에 지도가 다 그려질 겁니다. 그 때부터 우리는 원하는 도전과제를 수월하게 '저격' 할 수가 있습니다. 어려운 부분이 있다면 가이드 및 구글링을 통해 헤쳐나갈 수 있을 겁니다. 

⠀이 글을 쓰는 지금, 저는 이 게임에 진절머리가 난 상태입니다. 아마 내 평생 가장 사람을 녹초로 만들게 하는 '포인트&클릭' 장르 게임으로 기억되겠죠. 진짜 과장이 아닙니다. 저처럼 가벼운 마음으로 [i]'오, 포인트&클릭? 내가 또 그런 거 좀 좋아하지.'[/i] 라며 시작하시지 말길 바랍니다. 심호흡하고, 신중하게 행동하세요. 보이는 길에 횃불은 꼭 모조리 먹으시구요. 당신의 잘못된 행동이 쌓이고 쌓여, 어둠에 잠식되기 싫다면 말이죠.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973742846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1513215834}

review: Без перевода проходить-только наугад.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979388466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1525824777}
review:
Banshee curse. It kills you if you dont find the cure in time. you wont find cure in time if you dont know what to do. You dont know what to do if you wont search it from internet. I have played many point and click games and this is the first time i had to go search the answer from google. For me thats the mark of poor game design. Played it on journeyman nad found out that lifting the curse is easier on easy mode but game is not good enough for me to bother restarting from the start.

Dont bother with this piece of shit. There are a lot better point&CLICK games on steam::::

author: {'steamid': '76561198025516495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1604762017}
review: Refonte capturant parfaitement l'esprit de l'original tout en le modernisant là où il le fallait. Visuellement superbe, musiques splendides, résolution des énigmes logique la grande majorité du temps, juste quelques petites fautes de traduction de temps en temps. Pour les fans de point&clic à l'ambiance envoûtante !

author: {'steamid': '76561198045141882', 'num_games_owned': 579, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 2435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2435, 'last_played': 1498722468}
review: Great remake, it was fun discovering different things you might have missed the first time, is well worth it to go through all the difficulties and achievements.  Still dont like the idea that some items are useless like a couple keys and a couple doors that never open.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995562619', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1661, 'last_played': 1505685685}
review: Its been a while since I played a Dungeon adventure game. And going back to shadowgate was great. I loved playing this game on the NES. The fact that the puzzles were changed and upgraded makes it that much more fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964346162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1505574456}
review:
Wonderful update to an old classic - much better graphics. 

I enoyed it, however you are on a timer and if you do not complete in time, have to play the whole game again.
This is not cool.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045220135', 'num_games_owned': 1190, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2272, 'last_played': 1509273402}
review:
Fantástico remastered de esta aventura gráfica con dificultad elevada.

Después de jugarlo y pasarmelo en "clásico maestro", solo decir que el juego me ha encantado: la narrativa, ambientación y trama. Una aventura gráfica de las que se echan en falta hoy dia.

Recomiendo conseguir los logros pues también son bastante divertidos de hacer, sobre todo el de las "muertes secretas".

author: {'steamid': '76561198003631784', 'num_games_owned': 1276, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1504461032}
review:
Je n'ai pas réussi à jouer longtemps, c'est juste que ce genre de jeu n'est pas pour moi je n'aime pas les point & click. J'ai fini par regarder un lets play parce que je trouver la D.A  et l'ambiance cool et que je n'avais pas la foie de me faire le jeu moi même.

Le plus moins

Les plus : 
+ La D.A est superbe, le jeu de 87 posait d'excelentes bases qui ont été bien repris dans la remastered pour un rendu très cohérents
+ Les musiques que ce soit la version 87 ou la 2014 elles sont cools
+ L'histoire est assez sympa
+ L'ambiance globale
+ L'interface est bien pensé
+ Pas mal de tableau

Les +/-
/ C'est un P&C et comme dit plus au haut c'est pas fait pour moi
/ Le prix ni bon ni mauvais je ne sais pas quoi en passé

Les moins :
- La traduction française est un peu bancal
- Des choix pas toujours cohérents
- On revoie parfois trop souvent certains tableaux

author: {'steamid': '76561198046791871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1454, 'last_played': 1504224692}
review:
A great game from a bygone era, remade to play beautifully today.  I never played the original, so there is no nostalgia here.   It's just an extremely well done game.  Some very intelligent use of items in the puzzles as well.

Stop reading reviews; install and go on a wonderful adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144711098', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1489238705}
review: great!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972040704', 'num_games_owned': 1844, 'num_reviews': 725, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1446931929}
review:
I will catch hell from fans, but there are a significant number of people who hate having to work against a timer in a game. It's not necessarily a universal thing, at least for me, anyway. Shadowgate is one such game. You are cursed when you start, and unless you can get far enough in the game to lift the curse, you will die after a while. Anyone who really hates that sort of thing may wish to steer clear of Shadowgate.

If that doesn't bother you, though, you might enjoy it. For me, it's sadly a deal-breaker.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032268167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1501529455}
review:
Ein sehr schönes altmodisches Point & Click Adventures, das die Story im Stil eines Pen & Paper Rollenspiel Dungeons erzählt. Die Cutszenes sind vertont, ansonsten wird die Story mit Textfenstern erzählt, was ich aber nicht störend empfinde. Besonders gut finde ich die witzigen Kommentare, wenn man irgend etwas unsinniges versucht, was mich sehr an meine alten Rollenspielrunden erinnert hat.

Ich hatte weder Grafikfehler noch Probleme in Full HD zu spielen. Die Grafik ist im Zeichen Stil gehalten und geht in Ordnung.
Die Rätsel sind nicht sehr schwer und zur Not gibt es eine Hilfefunktion, die einem Tipps gibt.
Ich habe auf dem leichtesten Schwierigkeitsgrad gespielt und musste deshalb das Spiel auch nicht mehrfach von vorne beginnen, weil ich am Anfang einen Fehler gemacht hätte. Also ich konnte in eins durchspielen.
Sterben kann man häufiger, deshalb sollte man öfters speichern. Meistens sind die Situationen aber vorhersehbar, wenn es gefährlich wird.
Was ich sehr gut finde ist, dass alles was man machen muss sehr nachvollziehbar sind. Wenn ich z.B. etwas kaputt schlagen muss, geht es mit einem Hammer. Auch kann man mit vielen Gegenständen interagieren, die für die Story zwar nicht relevant sind, aber sehr viel Atmosphäre geben. So kann man z.B. Kisten zerschlagen oder Wandteppiche anzünden.

Von mir eine absolute Empfehlung für alle Rollenspieler und Fans der alten Dungeon Point & Click Adventures, die Spaß an einer Story haben, die in Textboxen erzählt wird.

author: {'steamid': '76561198356595500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1500302335}
review:
Che dire, una meravigliosa avventura. Abbastanza difficile in alcuni passaggi ma una volta risolti il gioco da una soddisfazione notevole.
Lo consiglio a tutti quelli a cui piacciono le sfide.
l'ho terminato in circa 8 ore.
Tecnicamente è stato rifatto in maniera magistrale con disegni e musiche magnifiche.
L'ho acquistato in offerta a euro 2,99 ma è un gioco che vale molto di più.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015952317', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1500278388}
review:
The original game when it was ported to the NES was one of my favorite games. In fact, I still own the original cart back when I got it ages ago as a kid. The remake has many aspects that harken to the original and enough headscratching to warrant relearning the new puzzles.
Though...that's where my postiives end. Too many cultural references that don't really belong in the game, inconsistent audio and entire large sections of the original ripped out for little to no reason have me feel honestly...that something was missing. The game certainly captures the feel of the original, and I'd certainly suggest it to people who have not played the original. 
Maybe my nostalgia blinders are on a little thick, but I just feel the original has more depth to it, and more life when you replay it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155374859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1543328296}
review:
J'y ai joue une heure mais cela me semble suffisant pour dire que ce jeu est bon. Graphiquement il tient la route sur un aspect moyen âge, l'histoire est captivant et certaines énigmes demanderons de la réflexion.
Si vous êtes fan du point and click et d'une histoire moyen âgeuse alors ce jeu est fait pour vous.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986771754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1662652357}
review: This game is very true to the original Shadowgate games (I played the NES version) and holds true with its puzzles and amazing visuals, sounds, and music. It makes you feel more like you are there and I especially appreciate the background artwork and animations and cutscenes. If you loved playing games like the original Shadowgate, Deja Vu, Uninvited, ect. then I highly recommend this game. Its a nostalgia game remade right!

author: {'steamid': '76561198147902860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1499845304}
review: Я наверное один из немногих тех кто играл в оригинальный Shadowgate вышедший в далеком 1987 году. И при всей своей крутости, а она была просто шикарна для тех времен. Эта игра оставила  у меня отрицательные воспоминания. Я был мелкий и хотел Пиу Пиу Пиу а не бродить по подземельям и решать загадки.  И спустя десятки лет, я захотел решать загадки и бродить по подземельям, потому что пиу пиу пиу уже надоело за эти годы.   И на обум забив Shadowgate в Steam, почти не веря в то что он тут есть. Я попал на этот Ремейк. И данная игра меня удивила и порадовала. Это просто шикарный старорежимный квест,  который заставляет плакать от своей сложности, в котором есть режим для старой школы игроков. И ты можешь настроить игру для себя. И от перемены тех или инных режимов атмосфера загадочности, сказочности и путешествия - остается все той же. И для меня эта игра однозначно  входит в 10-ку лучших ремейков старых игр.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273968677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 795, 'last_played': 1499843341}

author: {'steamid': '76561198105592478', 'num_games_owned': 1117, 'num_reviews': 1354, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1497238367}

author: {'steamid': '76561198138114937', 'num_games_owned': 493, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1494387502}
review: When I first saw the remastered version of this game out, I was very excited. After playing it, I do enjoy it, but there could be improvement. I own the one on NES and it does play quite different from this one. This is a little more complicated and doesn't have as good of an interface as the one on the NES. I also need the retrographics on to obviously point out what to click on. Remastered graphics look much nicer but I seem to just play with full retro grpahics on. Overall, this game is better than the MacVenture version of the game, but I still am biased for the NES version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106288150', 'num_games_owned': 1015, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1495944820}
review: Shit game. Glad I only paid $1 for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107081879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1495407035}
review:
Ce jeu est très beau et très prenant, et c'est avec grand plaisir qu'on explore chaque nouveau lieu.
Une partie en soi est assez courte, mais la rejouabilité est élevée, étant donné que certaines énigmes et certaines pièces ne peuvent être débloquées qu'à un niveau de difficulté supérieur.
Seul bémol, les aller-retours récurrents assez fastidieux.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097919456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1514655173}

author: {'steamid': '76561198168135000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1467654747}
review: Shadowgate was one if my favorite games growing up! As soon as i saw it was rebooted i was looking forward to playing again. Unfortunately i didnt get very far due to the excessive flashing lights. If you are epileptic i would not recommend this game. I would definitely play if they could fix that issue thought. All of that aside, i love the mechanics of the game and the stories tied to it. I really recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259661229', 'num_games_owned': 831, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 3775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2770, 'last_played': 1672687367}
review:
Excelente juego, me gusta la dificultad y su ambientación.

Conserva toda la esencia del juego original.

Te permite elegiir en vualquier momento del juego cambiar la banda sonora de la nueva a la original.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969565286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1495662224}
review:
Ich glaube das dieses Spiel wirklich Spaß macht, da ich das Original kenne und der Ersteindruck der Rätsel und Bedienung mich ansprechen. Es gibt aber leider zwei ganz gravierende Fehler:
1) Massive Grafikfehler wie auf diesen Screenshots zu erkennen
https://www.picflash.org/picture.php?key=3O6N7F&action=show
https://www.picflash.org/picture.php?key=6Z8SWJ&action=show

2) Standardmäßig ist die Auflösung auf 720p eingestellt was ich im Fenstermodus ganz angenehm finde. Wechselt man aber auf 1080p kann man hinterher nicht mehr zurück auf 720p. (Siehe Screenshot) Das wird dann ärgerlich, wenn man gerne mal im Vollbildmodus spielen will, aber auch mal im Fensrermodus.
https://www.picflash.org/picture.php?key=PHELHZ&action=show

Insbesondere wegen der Grafikfehler die das Spiel auf meinem Heim-PC für mich unspielbar machen kann ich auch keine Empfehlung aussprechen.

Betriebssystem: Windows 7 x64
Grafikkarte: AMD Radeon R9 280X
Treibersion: 17.5.1

author: {'steamid': '76561197970078168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 460, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1492546288}
review:
Good old-school adventure/rpg game.
Some puzzles are hard to figure out and, you should try everything until you can sort them.
Story is ok. Graphics are good enough and, the gaming experience is overall good.
What I am missing is an interactive map. You will need to go back many times and, to walk back all the path is a mess.
I don't feel comfortable the interface to interact with objects, neither.
But none of those aspects are so critical to shadow the good aspects of the game.
If you like old-school adventure/rgp games with complex puzzles, try it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078094386', 'num_games_owned': 828, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1492557718}
review: realmente un juego muy bueno y extraño a la vez, esta realmente bien hecho y pensado, algunos de los puzzles son muy censillos de resolver, pero cuesta por que capas no te das cuenta en el momento o pensaste que no podias hacer tal cosa, eso aveces frusta un poco al jugador pero para nada es algo malo, es mas creo que le da esa escensia que necesitan este tipo de juegos, soy muy novato en este estilo de video juego pero valio la pena la compra, realmente lo recomiendo, pensa muy bien todos tus movimientos y toca la gran mayoria de cosas en pantalla, nunca sabras que sirve y que no amenos que pruebes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028207956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1491405295}
review:
Personalmente la ritengo una delle peggiori avventure mai viste.
Al contrario di come avviene di solito qui l'obiettivo non è solo trovare la soluzione, a volte con azioni fuori dalla logica del contesto, ma occorre farlo nel minor numero di mosse possibili altrimenti la torcia si spegne e si muore costringendo quindi a rifare tutto da capo escludendo le mosse che non portano benefici ai fini del risultato finale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043895421', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 521, 'last_played': 1489039896}
review:
This is a fantastic game.

I originally played Shadowgate for NES and a lot of it's feel (and some design) is very much the same. Some things are missing it seems now but still have references (the toll troll on the bridge and coins for example).

I beat the original as a kid and I remember there was a storyline but it wasn't very clear. Of course, no kid really wants to put pieces together manually like we are looking at Dark Souls storyline so I never really followed along. I really liked the story and this game's concept. The thing I really appreciate I think is that this is remastered by the original development team. This isn't just some title someone took and used to sell their own idea, it's the original creators reforging an idea they had. I appreciate that a lot, and this game was made with care.

The curse was a pain but it was so fulfilling to remove it. Some of the puzzles are very abstract but none of them are beyond reach.

The music was really nice to hear as well. The remastered tracks are good.

There is honestly a firm chance that the firm approval I have for this game is heavily influenced by my childhood memories of the game and it's similar counterparts (Such as Deja Vu). As a puzzle game it's quite good and it captured the feel of Shadowgate remarkably well. I cannot wait to try Beyond Shadowgate (never knew there was a sequel at all) when they finish the remake of it, which should be somewhat soon I believe. Keep it up, you amazing development team you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198333672067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1498901805}
review: also ich habe mit 3 weiteren verrückten eine wette gemacht das wir random spiele 2 stunden antesten. und nun habe ich das spiel "shadowgate" zogen. In verhältniss zu meinen anderen freunden hatte ich wohl eines der besten spiele gezogen und muss erlich sagen, dass man, trotz den geringen geldbetrag, mehrere stunden daran spielen kann. es ist überraschenderweise ein ziemlich guter point-and-klick-advanture. da ich die remake versoin gezogen habe, interressierte ich mich erst an dem vorgänger und sah direkt, dass man verschiedene schwierichkeitsgrade spielen konnte, was ich erstmal positiv stimmte und ich auch direkt auf "master" schaltete, da ich eine herrausvorderung begrüßen wollte (hätte ich das wohl besser mal nicht getahn. ._.). nun, dass der hauptcharakter bewaffnet zu einer festung geht um dort das böse zu verteiben ist nicht schwer zu erkennen, aber warum muss man den tode geweiht sein wenn man keine angezündete fackel mehr hat? (anfängerfehler! darauf achten bitte :P). jedoch wenn man nach seinen ersten tod weiter gekommen ist als den 2ten raum, dann kann man auch sehr stak erkennen, dass das spiel auch unerwartete momente hat, wie zum beispiel die geisterdame die dich verfluchen kann (gehe aufgrund von spoilern nicht weiter darauf ein) oder kugeln die sich anscheinend der umgebung angepsst haben (ich habe immernoch keine ahnung was die machen sollen). aber es ist ja kein point-and-klick-advanture wewnn es keine gegner gibt. daher hat das spiel auch einen ziemlich starken gegner, an dem ich auch nicht vorbeigekommen bin, und desshalb schnell in ner zwickmühle landete. das spiel ist so gütig dem hilflosem charakter einen sprechenden schädel zu geben der ihm helfen soll. entweder bin ich aus dem hinweis "ich frage mich ob meine schwester noch lebt" nicht schlau geworden oder der schädel labert nur dummes zeug. ich wäre auch damit zufrieden, wenn es nur anseitsweise hinweise gibt auf das weitere vorrankommen, aber abgesehen von dem schädel gibt es keinen der dem hauptcharakter helfen könnte. in allgemeinen gibt aber das spiel eine bedrückende und düstere athmosphäre aus und man merkt schnell,dass dies spiel von der lebt. wegen den unnützen sprechenden schädel gebe ich dem spiel nur 8/10 hilfreichen todeschädeln und die hoffnung, dass dieser unnütze schädel in einem späteren zeitpunkt nützlicher ist als ich ihn einschätze...

author: {'steamid': '76561198018485266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1468128879}
review:
其实这是一个很古老的系列，它从最初128k黑白色版本，到2014年重新描绘的复刻版本，有着一段相当漫长的历史。本作在当时是Zojoi 开发的一系列主视角冒险游戏中的一员，它的姐妹作品Deja Vu似乎在那时侯还要更加出名一些，现在在Steam上你可以通过“MacVenture Series Collection”一次性收集到所有的作品。

很显然的，这部作品在冒险解谜游戏的历史上，有着与其名声不太相符的重要地位。事实上在它的背后，有着对许多后来欧美游戏的启迪，包括它奇特的物品设计，以及对于纸笔桌游的场景描述移植到图形表现上的尝试。与现在许多游戏强调简单易上手的操作截然不同，那完全没有任何提示与“报错”设计的操作，在提高了玩家的血压同时，也极大的赋予了游戏的自由感。

一位英雄该是怎样的死法？我在旧版中遇到最初的难题，不是什么新人杀手怪或是机关陷阱，而是学会如何不让主角扭到脚摔断自己脖子.....................

伴随着游戏对玩家的放任不管，所带来的结果便是各种死亡，草率的拉到机关或是盲目前进，遇到危机时无法及时做出反应。前往下一个区域时忘了举起你的盾牌，甚至是在火把烧完之前忘了添火，而导致主角在黑暗中不小心摔倒，伴着那清脆的“bia ji”一声，你的脖子就这么摔断了。

14年的新版本是一个非常优秀的重制游戏。不仅全程用精美的手绘图替换了所有场景，还将文本叙事在保留原本故事的前提下，重新给予了更高的水准。游戏的系统被开发者用现代化的方式打造了一遍，玩家仍然可以体验到其复古的本质（这点从主角伴随全程的惨叫可以体会到），但优化过后的操作与更亲切的便利化（主要体现在你死后重试的快捷性）让新玩家也可以很愉快（？）的游玩。

本作是一个经典的重生，目前一大帮国外玩家开始喊着要Deja Vu的重制了。无论你是否玩过Shadowgate，只要你喜欢点击型冒险解谜，或是希望玩到具有桌游气质的非RPG游戏，都可以尝试一下这个有着悠久历史的作品。

author: {'steamid': '76561198040830517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 690, 'last_played': 1477234270}
review: I remember growing up playing this on the NES.  Later I would pick up a copy for my gameboy, and played so often I could play through every single language setting.  (Which itself was worth doing since it featured graphic changes in a few key events.)  Anyhoo, When the game was Kickstarted, I didn't hesitate to support one of my all time favorites.  This modern update is successful in capturing the atmosphere of the original, while also building on the elements that made it so great.  The music, the puzzles, it's all there, and then some.  Better still, it has difficulty settings to make the game harder for the diehard fans of the game.  I gave it a playthrough, and found it to be much more challenging than it's NES version.  That's great news, because after a few decades, the property was really deserving of the chance to realize it potential as a puzzler.  It was great then, and in my opinion, it's still great now.  It's not perfect, but it's deserving of it's positive reception.

author: {'steamid': '76561198177918369', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2058, 'last_played': 1661979700}
review:
I will start off by saying that Shadowgate(2014) was the main reason I even opened up a Steam account. I played Shadowgate on NES back in the mid-2000s decade, as I had never played it as a kid. As far as point and click adventures go, it's certainly one of the best ever, and this remake does not disappoint. The atmosphere, enhanced graphics, well told story, remixed music, different difficulty modes, and varied puzzles and paths make this one outshine the original version even. With various customization options, anyone who enjoys point and click adventure titles will feel right at home with Shadowgate.  

 For the best experience during gameplay, I like to set the music to retro 8-bit style and play that way. That music when the torch is about to run out always puts me on edge, and heightens the foreboding mood that a game like this is supposed to have. Some of the puzzles are the same as the original- such as needing to grab a shield to block the dragon's flame in the treasure room- but others require slightly different approaches than the original game, especially on Master difficulty. If you don't use a walkthrough, it will take quite some time to get through the game. Beyond that, I am certainly not going to spoil anything, so try it and find out for yourself. 

Overall, I highly recommend Shadowgate(2014). It truly is one of the definitive point and click adventure games around.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990974942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1493089077}
review: A great remake that turns the original puzzles into something fresh for those familiar with the NES or original MacVenture versions

author: {'steamid': '76561198053976414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1005, 'last_played': 1561563451}
review:
It takes a special game to give you life-long memories - and even more special game to both give you childhood traumas and make you remember it with fondness.

Shadowgate's remake is, in my opinion, a good mixture of old and new. Some puzzles are very similar to the ones in the classic version, yet there are plenty of new ones and some which look a lot like the old ones but might surprise old-timers. The option to switch between remixed music and NES tracks, as well as other retro elements, was also a nice plus.

Some of the puzzles were slightly frustrating and I admit that I resorted to using a walkthrough when I got stuck in a certain point with the curse, but all in all, I would recommend Shadowgate to anyone who likes point-and-click adventures and dark fantasy (which doesn't take it too seriously, though). I liked the art, the music and the general 'feel' of the game, and though the story is relatively simple, it serves its purpose in this tribute to the old MacVenture classic.

Maybe it was worth it to fear the dark and Grim Reaper for 20 years or so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106326554', 'num_games_owned': 592, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1555, 'last_played': 1508982351}
review:
Was looking through my games and thought I should write a review for this game. I enjoyed the old mac-adventures that were made years ago, and Shadowgate has always been a memorable one over the years. These games were difficult as **** but they always brought a unique feeling of mystery and adventure.

This remake was a blast to play through. The harder difficulties are - difficult as **** and require a guide if you lack patience like me. I'm not the best at these games, but I enjoy them still. They inspire me to create my own adventures.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995749658', 'num_games_owned': 1958, 'num_reviews': 1565, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1479098591}
review:
Point n Click Adventure aus Ego Sicht.
Wie Myst nur mit Text / manchmal Sprache.
Wie bei Myst sind die Rätsel entweder grenzdebil offensichtlich oder zu absurd und Try/errorig.
Z.B. muss man wirklich GENAU das richtige Item benutzen um den Spiegel zu zerstören, alles andere gibt nicht mal einen Hinweis.
Riesige Welt und jede Menge Gegenstände + imho nichtssagende Schriftrollen, machen was das rätseln nicht einfacher.
Ach ja man kann (auf vielfältige Art und Weise) sterben. Also Quicksave wie in King's Quest ist angesagt. Na ja.
Ansonsten schön und stimmungsvoll gemacht.
Technisch sauber.
Für geduldige Entdecker und solche die sich nicht scheuen auch mal in eine Lösung zu schauen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011965365', 'num_games_owned': 2442, 'num_reviews': 2080, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1481806114}
review: As we venture into the new age of gaming, some aspects are lost to us. It might take a long time for the mainstream to pick them back up again. Thankfully there are ways to keep the old flame burning. Shadowgate is one of these old flames. Not many games can match the atmosphere and ambiance of this gem. Puzzles that vex the mind or art and illustrations that bring you wonder. Many choices you can make against the harshness of the very game itself. This game will be a challenge to you and if you play long enough you will find yourself hooked. The achievements are a breath of fresh air as well, bringing re playability to it's very maximum.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014092034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1430027942}
review: If you played/loved the original, you'll love this one. You'll love this one even if you didn't play the original. The graphics and sound are great. It makes you think.

review: A pretty great point and click adventure. It's sort of a remake of the original MacVenture game. A few of the same rooms and some of the same enemies appear. If you're coming into this after beating the original, like me, you'll notice that the way you progress through the castle is very similar to the first game, but also very different. author: {'steamid': '76561198006506395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 752, 'last_played': 1408760852}
review:
A fun throwback to childhood memories of struggling with seemingly impossible puzzles for hours on end..

But not really.
Maybe it's just me being all grown up, but the puzzles didn't really challenge me, or awe me, call me jaded, perhaps.

It's nostalgia, pure and simple.

It's still a good game to though.

Worth the price of admission.

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198009902551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1533410368}
review: Too Tedious. just this simple.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039104459', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1651880574}
review:
I have tons of fond memories of the original Shadowgate... Most include me dying and seeing that laughing Grim Reaper. (Hey, I think he's laughing.) 

This is one of those remake games that gets it. They managed to navigate the challenging terrain between people who have played the original and expecting that nostagic bliss and those who are new, who have different expectations for games. It's different enough that it's still a challenge if you've played the game before, but not so different that it's unfamiliar. 

That is one hell of a hurdle to do and this game does it flawlessly. Well played Zojoi. Well played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129528613', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1916, 'last_played': 1641877831}
review: A wounderful retelling of a classic. Everything from the graphical style, to the captivating sounds of orcestral stylized score, shows the love the team has for the game. I wait with anticipation to see how the sequal will be; I have no doubts that it will be done with the same love and appreciation.      To all who had a part in remaking this game, I say thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2304, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1472941025}
review:
Not many adventure games reached the classic NES, but Shadowgate was a stand-out among the few that did. The merciless journey through a deadly castle allowed you unprecedented freedom to Take, Open, Drink, and Hit just about anything you came across in the game world. Now Shadowgate has been re-imagined for the modern era, which means new graphics and new interfaces for a new audience. Surprisingly, it might still be plenty familiar to the masochists that loved the original as well.

The first place new Shadowgate diverges from the original is in the story, though it might not be immediatly apparent how much it does. You, being a strapping young warrior, are summoned by a mysterious wizard to the living castle of Shadowgate. Within its lethal, enchanted walls is an evil warlock seeking some world-ending power, and it's your job to puzzle up a way to stop him. Along the way you'll learn plenty about the circle of wizards who once inhabited the castle, the power they protected, and the lands beyond.

In terms of gameplay, this is a first-person point-and-click adventure. Each room is a static scene with features to examine and items to gather. Clicking on something brings up a context menu that allows you to perform all sorts of actions like looking, taking, opening, using, and more. Some items need to be used on yourself, some need to be combined, and so on. The objects you find are also helpfully sorted by type, which is a blessing once you realize how many damn scrolls you're going to find.

The other thing you'll find is a plethora of ways to die. OG Shadowgate wasn't shy about murdering you for daring to pick up a book or dipping your toe in a pool of water, and the remake carries over some of that, though most are locked behind the game's many difficulty levels. Most fatalities will come at the hands of the few monsters that serve to block your progress at different points. They tend not to be hard to dispatch but there's usually one correct option among a mess of more obvious ones. For example, one enemy can be dealt with by simply punching it in the face, but using any sort of weapon or spell on it means instant death.

This also brings me to my chief complaint about the game, the obscurity of some of the puzzles. Adventure games have thankfully moved far away from the days of cat hair mustaches and helium bubblegum tooth heists, but some still have problems directing the player to the right conclusions. There are plenty of puzzles in Shadowgate that have simple solutions that simply aren't telegraphed in any way, like the cure for the banshee curse or the ability to remove runes. You're sure to run into situations where you know what to do but not HOW precisely to do it, but also situations where it's just not clear how to progress.

Luckily this isn't a particularly damning complaint, because the game provides significant help like a very specific hint system (his name is Yorick) and a useful map that marks important points of interest. It also helps that you'll be exploring some rather lovely painted scenery, accompanied by quality sound work and inspiring riffs on the original soundtrack. And there are even retro options that make the game more like the original, setting some of the gameplay systems and interfaces and even the music back to their classic incarnations.

It's something you don't often see in remakes, a gradient of options between old and new, but it illustrates the love and attention that went into making it. And it doesn't hurt that there's a quality adventure that stands on its own hidden underneath. There's enough of the original Shadowgate here that longtime fans will appreciate the arcane puzzles and sudden fatalities, along with enough innovation to keep newcomers hooked.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/audish#curation]curation page[/url]!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989807190', 'num_games_owned': 2276, 'num_reviews': 599, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1469465067}
review:
I expected the game to be pretty bad. I had some experience with older Shadowgate, and knew what the game was all about - player finding countless ways to die. Which isn't what I find "a good gameplay". But there was certain charm to how insane Shadowgate was in it's leaps of logic or lack thereof, and how eager it was to kill you, and it even worked to a degree when using, say, an NES version of the game and savestating a lot. Which didn't make the game good, mind you, but at least entertaining. Which is why it is strange to see Shadowgate 2014 struggle with that in so many areas.

Now, I need to point out that the game now has a special "Normal" mode, which makes it work like a rather simplistic, but pretty cool in terms of the setting point and click adventure. It locks out all the unusable and incorrect solutions from the mouse interface, makes several puzzles a lot less complicated and makes it next to impossible to die. It is a fun way to play the game the first time if you're new to full playthroughs of the game, like I was, but it does make the entire game feel less charming in a way. You need to be really silly to die, it's impossible to screw anything up, no time limits, just rather simple puzzles and lots of exposition. So after you play through the game like that, you might want to start the Classic mode on one of the 3 difficulty modes.

And that's where the game has it's charm, yet mostly fails to improve on the original. It looks better, it's awesome to see how different some rooms and puzzles are across different difficulties, some deaths are still as stupid and fun. Yet, some of the silliness is gone. And, more importantly, the game doesn't feel like an improvement in controls over the original at all. The text box is tiny, some text requires you to see it all before you can do any actions, including some rooms that always do that. Inventory is a pain to go through, despite the hotkey possibilities, cutscenes are boring and slow. And, most importantly, when you die, the game wants you to sit until the grim reaper starts appearing, then you can skip it, then you're in the main menu, then you can load. Menu and quickload functionality is disabled. Meaning, that deaths are not entertaining, but slow and annoying occurances that still can come out of nowhere.

Of course, there's also the fact that after playing games like Legend of Grimrock, which shown that some fantasy-themed puzzle solving can be switched to realtime gameplay from pure pre-rendered point and click, Shadowgate feels rather shallow to play. It's a cool setting full of cool ideas, which would be so much more fun if they could be experienced in a faster and more immersive ways.

But it's just an okay update to an old game, that was never good, but has some weird entertaining value to it and an honestly pretty cool setting and ideas. Given how often the game goes on super cheap sales or pops up in bundles, there's no reason not to check it out for cheap some day. But don't expect much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041949592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 605, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1462985191}
review:
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a Point and click game.


[h1]Interface/Menu/Settings[/h1]

There is a Slidebar for the Music Volume.
There is a Slidebar for the Sound Volume.
There is a Slidebar for the Cinematic Volume.
You can play on Full screen or Windowed Mode.
You are able to change your controls on the keyboard.
There are some Resolution sizes.
There is a difficulty settings.

[h1]About the game.[/h1]

You a hero that is searching in a weird cave, full of surprises and many directions. You are able to learn spells which you need to unlock certain area's or revealments. Your character is able to die (depends on difficulty too) and your torches are able to die aswell (Depends on difficulty too). You are able to equip armor and weapons to help you surviving or this is a requirement. Making bad descisions or playing poorly will have results to death if playing on a higher difficulty. The game is pretty calm and enjoyable. You have an inventory where you will place items inside, able to read scrolls, using magic ability and even equip your character.

Graphics are pretty good.
Story is interesting.
You have a map which you can use know which rooms are connected to what. However you can't fast travel with this.
There are tips. (You are able to disable this).
You might not notice it. But whenever you are equipping something, the picture on the top right will also change. Which  is a nice minor thing.
The music is interesting.
It's voiced over at some parts.
Cinematics/cutscenes are nicely done.
You are able to skip Cinematics/cutscenes.
There are multiple save slots and you can loadgame.
There is IRONMODE (which disable saving).


[h1]Other things.[/h1]

Pressing F2 will show you any interactions you are able to do in a room.
You are able to hit "Yorick the skull" with an affect to reduce or increase back his talking and helpfulness.

-------------------

I Give this game a 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197971153258', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1460582586}
review:
I bought this game to really have to experience the Shadowgate experience in a HD version, that I previously played on the gameboy....
But I think personally, that this are not a worthy Shadowgate remake.

Its so much that was removed/changed/added in the game, that its really not Shadowgate anymore.


For example, the Epor spell, the bottle you drink to become lighter to cross the rotten bridge, the blade that is used with the staff in the final scene, the slingshot, the pay-to-cross the bridge creature, and yeah, those gems (red, blue, white) that you put in slots to open hidden doors. And of course, that iconic unpassable slime when you open the incorrect coffin.

Then much things that does not belong to shadowgate was added, for example those statues you can use the [spoiler]invokain[/spoiler] spell on, and the sphere that is aquired by putting the white gem into the slot (in the old gameboy version) is changed in a heavy way that requires it to be "charged" with different elementals.

So basically:
If you never played the original classic Shadowgate, then this game can be seen as a new adventure game.
If you however played the original classic Shadowgate, you will be very disappointed by this game.

review:
Vous vous souvenez des Livres Dont Vous Etes Le Héros ou bien les livres aux 100 quelque chose; bah là c'est la même. 
Avec une patte graphique, une très bonne ambiance sertie d'une excellente bande son; l'un des rares jeux qu'on va prendre plaisir à jouer dans le noir.
Les grosses versions sont agrémentées de la soundtrack, d'un superbe livre d'artworks, d'un calendrier (désormais dépassé mais avec des dessins tout aussi magnifiques).

author: {'steamid': '76561198080055380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1458145663}
review:
J'ai pas connu le jeu d'origine sur Mac ou même l'un des différent port mais c'est ré-édition est franchement très belle, la réalisation est là et l'interface est très intuitive. Après... ça reste du jeu d'aventure classique dans la mesure où il arrivera forcément un moment où vous allez tester tout ce qui se trouve dans votre inventaire pour tacher d'ouvrir une porte ou tout simplement, de passer à l'écran suivant.

A réserver aux gens patients qui n'ont pas peur de retourner sans cesse dans les même endroits pour vérifier si un détail ne leur a pas échappé, ce qui n'est pas mon cas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047439698', 'num_games_owned': 780, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 16780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4040, 'last_played': 1703745914}
review: Let me start off by saying, I played Shadowgate originally on the NES as a kid (probably between 9-13, several times over those years). I was honored when I was selected to beta test and help QA and work on this reimaging. It's everything I could ask for as a "remake/reimagining" of the classic I enjoyed from childhood. It's unforgivingly difficult, but not unreasonably so. I spent years trying to finish the oriignal. I was pleased to be one of the first to solve one of the game's tougher final puzzles during beta. It has sense had a few more pointers and things clearing up a bit of the vagueness (some of them because of my own suggestions). Dave Marsh and Karl Roelofs have both been amazingly receptive to ideas and suggestions, many of which they've incoprorated as this project grew from the original Kickstarter Backers up to those of us who were late-backers/early preorderers, to the beta and beyond. If you like puzzles and adventures, an amazing sountrack, and great old-school atmosphere, don't pass this up! I'm hoping they go to Uninvited or Beyond Shadowgate next! I'm more than happy to beta test for them anytime!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041985298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1455758049}
review:
La nostalgia me hizo volver a jugar este juego que ya jugue en su día en game boy. No me ha decepcionado sino que lo he disfrutado mucho un remozado completo, pero manteniendose original, buena historia, puzles muy entretenidos y lo mejor de todo engancha.
La única pega y quiza la peor, es que estamos acostumbrados a juegos de rol que nos llevan de la mano, o quizas tienen sistemas mas simplicados de los que maneja este juego, cosas que nos hara dar vueltas, cuando simplemente tienes lo que necesitas y es tan simple como usar el objeto sobre uno mismo.
Si puedes pillarlo a buen precio lo recomiendo sin dudar, lo puntuaria de 8 sobre 10, teniendo en cuenta que el 9 seria casi perfecto, y el 8 es muy bueno

author: {'steamid': '76561198000631340', 'num_games_owned': 416, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1579836245}
review:
It feels familiar but fresh at the same time!
If you're familiar with the MacVenture or even the NES version... well, expect so many changes. This remake has mostly the same layout, but it features new, challenging puzzles throughout the game.
My first thought was "If only it featured the NES music...", and guess what... It DOES have not only the NES music, but the transitions, and even text scrolling style (with the quill and all) as well. My only disappointment was the Retro graphic mode. It would have been perfect to feature NES-like graphics for nostalgia sake. But what the retro graphics do is just to pixelate everything. Also, sometimes it might be frustrating as well since you'll probably end up stuck at some point. Besides those details, this is a game I would recommend especially if you're familiar with Shadowgate.

review: Shadowgate é um jogo super difícil de puzzle, ele retrata um personagem que entra em uma espécie de mansão e vai descobrindo o que se passa nela, o personagem vai ganhando itens e tem que tomar cuidado com diversos obstaculos pelo caminho como a queda de pontes, pessoas mortas, a investigação em bueiras, totens que revelam coisas, a invocação de magias para a descobertas de outros pontos no jogo que fazem com que o jogador pensa bastante e fique toda hora antenado e se ligue como que o jogo recorre, o jogo apresenta também bastante pergaminhos que fazem o usuário pensar bastante como foi modelada a parte do jogo (pra quem curte ler em inglês é claro) e permite muitas horas de jogo, super recomendo !!!
