review: This remake takes me back in time to my NES days of racking my brain for hours trying to figure out what to do but with much less frustration. If you get stuck you have the option for hints. Loved this game then, love this re-make now! Nice job.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960830547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1450908205}
review:
i LOVED this game when i was a kid playing it on the NES, i cant believe there is a rebirth of this beautiful experience!!!
I havent played it too long yet due to stress, but.. it's Shadowgate with only slightly changed quests and WAY better graphics and controls... what more does one want

author: {'steamid': '76561198097738062', 'num_games_owned': 759, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 1227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1113, 'last_played': 1513941546}
review: Well, they really nailed the feel of the original, while still making a whole new game. This unfortunately also means some of the puzzles are kind of BS leaps in logic, but so it was before. Production values are great - excellent art, music and voice acting. The writing is high quality and pretty hilarious at times. If you're in it for nostalgia, Shadowgate is 100% successful. If you're looking for a puzzle game, it's good, but be prepared to use a guide a couple times at least.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051925516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1428276195}
review:
I greatly enjoyed the NES version of this game years ago.  The 2014 remake is a very similar game, but the graphics and sound have been upgraded, and a lot of extra little additions have been included to make the experience more enjoyable.  For people like me, who grew up with the game, it's a genuine treat to see it given a modern day face-lift.  For people who are not acquainted with this kind of old-school puzzle game that uses a lot of "video-game logic", the puzzles could come off as confusing and overly obtuse.  

But let's be honest:  the puzzles are fun and all, but the bigger draw of this game is in finding how many horrible ways your character can die.  Everyone who has played the game for an extended length of time will understand that, and this new version does not disappoint.  Now, if they would only give the same treatment to "Uninvited" and "Deja' vu".

author: {'steamid': '76561198025110667', 'num_games_owned': 477, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1662287932}
review: I love this game, it's just a point and click played from a first person pov. But the artwork is gorgeous and the game is very immersive considering it's simple structure. If you like a dark fantasy backdrop and a point and click style of play, look no further.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101929162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 575, 'last_played': 1634387886}
review:
I think that this game simply could be better. It is nearly impossible to finish it with proper instructions which is dissapointing, because I love the graphic.

10 points for graphic, 4 points for gameplay, judge me, but it could be more with better logic gameplay and less stuck moments

author: {'steamid': '76561197976498153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1451879866}
review: Molto deluso da questo Shadowgate. Fondamentalmente parliamo di un avventura punta e clicca in prima persona ma con parecchie particolarità: Si può morire, e tanto, si può raccogliere qualsiasi cosa (ad un certo punto avevo 10 teschi e tibie nell'inventario..), si può persino rompere o mangiare oggetti chiave. Tutta questa libertà sarebbe anche interessante, ma il risultato è una frustrazione mica da ridere. La cosa che più mi ha infastidito però è una vaghezza generale sul cosa bisogna fare, vaghezza che ritorna anche in altri aspetti del gioco, per esempio gli incantesimi non ci viene detto cosa fanno, ne abbiamo solo una vaga, per l'appunto, descrizione. Le sezioni in cui si può morire si risolvono in un trial & error finché non troviamo l'azione risolutiva, not fun. Come se non bastasse una maledizione mortale ci ucciderà dopo un certo numero di mosse. Anche le torce si consumano dopo un certo numero di mosse, e restare al buio vuol dire game over. Nota stonata anche la trama, la quale ci mette semplicemente contro il solito mago oscuro che per qualche motivo odia tutti. Di positivo ci sono gli splendidi fondali, i testi scritti in maniera egregia (non tradotti benissimo a dirla tutta) ed un sistema di livelli di difficoltà che dovrebbe limitare i difetti sopracitati. Se cercate un esperienza anni '80 ecco il gioco che fa per voi.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965361562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1561907807}
review: VERY well done. Captured the original perfectly yet added incredible artwork.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980115616', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1541960879}
review:
This game is fantastic.  The thought provoking (for those with patience) puzzles overlaid by an awe-inspiring combination of eye and ear candy lend themselves well to a time-tested game mechanic.  The wait from crowd-funding to release seemed unbearable, particularly since I was waiting on the iOS release (then sold my iPad and forgot about this game until it popped up in a random search here on Steam).  

I'm thankful I took the time to give this an honest play-through to find that they're working on a remake of the TG16 sequel, Beyond Shadowgate!  I never got to play the original version of the sequel, so I'm quite excited for its release. 

Visuals: 10/10, Musical Score: 10/10, Ability to trigger a nostaliga-gasm: 10/10.

10 out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041516169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1451338771}
review:
Pros: New music, sounds, graphics. Plays more like a hidden-object game.

Cons:
MOTHERFUCKING BANSHEE!
Remember the bamshee that popped out of the coffin in Shadowgate Classic? It now activates a click-counter. After X number of clicks here and there, YOU DIE. Save your game without knowing where the antidote is? Your save is now fucked. Found the room that sends you back to the start without warning? More clicks for the counter! One of the rooms in the first Hall by the dragon gets inexplicably blocked by an energy force, so you have to walk the long way around, up through the Mirror-room floor.

Oh and the mirror room. Remember how 2/3 mirrors killed you? There are now 6 and NONE of them kill you!
EPOR now does nothing as you can climb through the hole without it.
Rock in a sling? "Death to the philistine"? I found one but both goblins I faced I simply HIT them.
Don't even bother with 'Classic' graphics mode either, as it simply makes everything super grainy.

Many of the puzzles are so obscure. I found a gear somewhere, but needed a walkthrough to find the mechanism in the floor where it goes.. except it doesn't go there. Actually you have to pry off one of the existing gears in the hatch with your sword, to see the lever positions, then put the gear back to use them.

How about the Library, remember the library? Red gem in the hole opens the bookcase...
Or how about clicking twice (once to open the menu, once to activate the book) on every book in 2 rows until you find 5 books that unlock the wall! If 'click everything until it works' is your security system, just use a doorknob!

Don't forget to use the rope & grappling hook on yourself to separate them if you forgot to climb down into the well before opening the drawbridge! You'll need the guantlet to piuch out the second troll, oh were you expecting to use that on an acid fountain?

Oh, and periodically return to the very start of the game to add a skull to the doorway. Yes, rune skulls act like batteries, 'activating' the mechanisms in the castle as if it were Devil May Cry.

Ya, so about that banshee. All of the hours my profile say that I have spent playing the game so far? Fucking garbage! Back to square one! If you do pick it up, look up how to get the antidote, and get it ASAP!

author: {'steamid': '76561198075673573', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 272, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1451196995}
review:
I rate the game Shadowgate (2014) 3/5. OK...if you like that sort of thing. For me, this was a bit of a nostalgic jaunt.

This is a nice little remake of the original Shadowgate mystery/puzzle game and probably would be a good game for those who miss the Myst style of gaming experience as this game requires a logic, all too often all its own, to solve the numerous puzzles of which this game is comprised. The graphics consist of mostly still or partially animated pictures which you click on with a mouse pointer while using different menu options to modify the effect of your clicks (you can also use hotkeys on the keyboard). Unlike the first iteration of Shadowgate the creators of this game have attempted to make the game feel less arbitrary and frustrating. The inclusion of multiple difficulty levels helps decrease frustration and increase replayability also. Unfortunately, this game has only 2 possible endings. 1) You die somehow and 2) You defeat the dread warlock lord and live unhappily ever after (due to the presence of an advertisement for a sequel).

+Good, relatively logical puzzles (so far as this type of game is concerned).
+Adequate controls for such a point-and-click style of game.
+Adequate writing.
+Will heavily remind you of the original without being as frustrating as the original.
+Multiple difficulty levels.
+No bugs.

+/-Mediocre sound with adequate voice acting.

-Not a great sense of mystery for such a puzzle type game.
-Mediocre (at best) graphics in a odd storyboard/storybook style.
-Fairly sedate music which can become repetitive over time.
-The ending is severely hampered by an advertisement for a sequel.
-Fairly generic story.
-Some obtuse puzzles may require you to read a game walkthrough to figure them out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066135987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1428533769}
review:
Started up the game and couldn't figure out how to get into the actual dungeon that the game takes place in.

Closed out and forgot about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961087218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1620512239}
review:
Great art direction and music. In general, they nailed to "Spooky evil castle"-feeling. A classic reborn, indeed.
Some will find the obscurity of the puzzles and the general tediousness of interacting with the environment to be very frustrating. I originally played it for 3 hours, then rage quit and put it down for 4 years.

But recently, I re-installed it. This time, for no particular reason, I had a much more enjoyable time.

Generally recommended for adventure game fans :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970186150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 1732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1172, 'last_played': 1665284969}
review: Incredible game brings me back to my childhood.  Love that it's a bit different and not exactly the same.  I like that it cahnges depending on the difficulty.  Not a fan of the time limiting curse.  I can deal with the torches and that's fine but all in all it's a great game.  May be hard as hell sort of and easy to get stuck but that's what walkthroughs are for to lend a hand.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110886970', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1441617420}
review: This is a faithful and accurate remake of one of my favorite NES games of all time. The fact that i can (and do) switch to the NES-style music instead of the beautiful orchestral version is a gigantic plus. The game isn't simply a remake of the classic, it adds new dimensions to the game and gameplay. The puzzles are just as well crafted, and require you to fumble about a bit before the lightbulb goes off and you are left beating your head on your desk for not noticing the answer sooner. The added content from DLC is also a nice touch, and seamless integrates into the world. If you loved the NES original, or if you hate yourself and feel you need to be punished for some crime you were never caught for, get this game immediatly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054560156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1436488763}
review: I wanted to like this game, I really did. Exploring a decrepit old castle full of monsters? I love that kind of stuff. The artwork and atmosphere are fantastic, but the logic behind all of it is bizarre. I can sum it up with one example: I ran into a goblin, my fist instinct is to kill it with my sword. But no, he dodged that and killed me. After exhausting every logical option I could think of I resorted to looking up a guide, it turns out I hand punch him instead. What kind of sense does that make? Something that does less damage and has shorter range works better just because that's what the developer wanted me to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987388969', 'num_games_owned': 1737, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1472468572}
review:
Shadowgate (2014) is a reboot of the original Shadowgate, released on the PC in 1987 for the Macventure series by apple, as well as on the Nintendo Entertainment System. Later on it saw a resurgence on the Gameboy Color also by Nintendo. This rebooted version has more modern looking graphics. The gameplay is still basically the same, though the HUD we were used to from the original is no more. Playing out the game it seems to be very similar to the original with subtle differences to the layout and puzzles, making it a new challenge to play. I recommend playing it on the hardest difficulty to get the most rewarding experience for those who are familiar with the original game. 

Normally rebooted games are something you would approach with caution, but this game did a good job of keeping the story intact, while making it a more modern playthough. Still fun, I think new generations will like it and older generations will enjoy the subtle differences and challenges. Thumbs up for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023312696', 'num_games_owned': 507, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1448984240}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009169294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1449443521}
review:
[h1]I thought this would be a fun game to sit back and just relax with,  maybe even play it on my laptop while watching TV.  I think this isn’t going to appeal to most gamers, and I don’t recommend it as I didn’t enjoy my time with it.[/h1]

[b]Pros[/b]
[*]A pretty good looking remake of a classic game.
[*]Funny commentary when trying to do things that don’t work.
[*]If you loved the original, I think you will like this.  I prefer the retro original, however.[/list]

[b]Cons[/b]
[*]The controls are obscure.  You can’t just click on something and expect anything to happen, you have to USE an item on something, or OPERATE something, or SMASH/HIT.  So if you want to know if a given point on the screen can be interacted with you have many possibilities just to find out..
[*]And worse, some things have to be clicked in the exact right spot.  There isn’t a lot of room for error.
[*]There are even hallways and corridors that are hardly visible on screen, you may not even know that going in that direction is an option.
[*]The inventory system is awful, I didn't realize it until I went back and played the original B&W version, which is a much better game, IMO.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993757408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1413731974}
review: Fun time killer...the learning curve from the old game is next to nothing. The puzzles are different though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083311446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1682185600}
review: An excellent Adaption of one of my favorite point and click games of my childhood. One of the best things about this game is the ability to revert some of the settings to retro, so that you can get some of the feel of the original.  I would recemmend that anyone who played Shadowgate when they werre young play this game, and anyone too young to remember the original should play it just because it's an awesome game with a great soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189155037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 4766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4766, 'last_played': 1438872981}
review:
Shadowgate is a turn-based point and click adventure game where you can do practically everything, even cleaning up the castle and burning every possible pieces of furniture down. I use the term "turn-based" here because every single step you take and every action you make brings you one step closer to your doom.

Story may seem a bit cliche, but considering that's it's a remake of a game that is almost 30 years old, I think that it's pretty much forgivable since this remake makes the game much more approachable to a wider audience.

Graphics feels top notched, and it's possibly my own computer issue or just me, but in retro graphics I can't seem to see anything that resembles anything. It's just a mish-mash of coloured pixels when trying to play in that mode.

Music can sometimes feel a bit eerie, giving you the "all-alone" feel which suits this theme and setting well.

UI feels a bit clunky if you use solely mouse to play, but fares better combining mouse and keyboard.

Difficulty is a welcome feature in this game as it makes it more approachable to people new to this kind of game especially where death looms at every step. It changes the amount of time (turns) you have left to complete tasks, especially the game in terms of torch life. It also changes the location of items as well as how much more complicated item combinations and puzzles will be.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982432567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1708806664}
review:
Having been a huge fan of Shadowgate since my NES days, I stumbled across this remake and felt compelled to buy it.  I own copies of the NES original, n64 version, and TurboGrafx CD version (Beyond Shadowgate).   So, being a fan I must had to buy the special edition with the OST. Now, I have not played the remake much as of yet...but playing through the first screens It became quite obvious that it was done with care and homage to the original versions. The new art is very nicely done and sets the tone. The game is true to the original and has familiar settings and puzzles.  I really enjoyed how you have the ability to change things to back to retro.  I personally enjoy turning on the retro music, screen transitions, and text.  Fantastic remake.  If you enjoyed the originals, do yourself a favor and play this.  Well worth it. 

A side note about the sound track: 
The Vanstratho metal mix is absolutely kick ass. All the original NES music metalified. I think I loved it the most when I first heard the death music chime in at 3 min 35 sec of the song and then go from acoustic to distortion until the song ended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067371366', 'num_games_owned': 2090, 'num_reviews': 583, 'playtime_forever': 1784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1023, 'last_played': 1471697819}
review:
I am not done with this game, only 15 hours so far and I don't even know if it is the end! It seems quite long, and it is very overwhelming, but since I enjoyed it so much so far and intend to go on until the end, I thought making it some justice by saying how good it is.
- very old school: it's a remake of a 87 classic reminding me of my journeys on Atari ST)
- very rich: items inventory is huge, gameplay is not only point n click based, but the more complex style "point n choose your action", like take open look use etc.
- pretty: although I say this criteria in an objective way, because personally I thought it looks a bit too amateurish, sometimes awkward, and much too much "photoshop layer A photoshop layer B photoshop layer C"... but the work on it is quite honorable, whether you personally like it or not (don't get me wrong, I do not particularly like it, but it is not unpleasant to look at in gaming terms- aesthetically speaking now that's another story
- the story seems simple and traditional so far, nor surprising nor boring, but I suppose that's the remake thing
- many places to go, many things to click, many items to pick and use, many spells to try out...
- the music is fine, nothing spectacular

I can not remember how much I paid for it, and one could argue it looks a bit like these casual games on tablets, but all in all, I think at a reasonable fee this game is really worth it. You enjoy point n clicks? You like the oldschoolish looks of it? do not hesitate, it is a good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043334491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1448769934}
review: A fun point and click, but the classic visuals are like trying to look at nudity on cable television. In fact, they more or less just add a pixelize filter. I think I speak for all of us when I say that classic style would work better if they just swapped out the art for something that looks more like the art from the NES title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073584574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1447695829}
review:
I recently replayed the old NES version back in January. As a child, this game scared the living hell out of me. The hour or two I've played has been amazing! It really is a trip down memory lane and the stylized art is gorgeous!

If you love point and click adventures like Myst, you're going to love this game. The normal price tag of $15 is a bit steep in my opinion but it is absolutely worth adding to your collection if it is ever on sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025660349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1589787532}
review:
Man, I miss when games didn't hold your hand like they do today.....

WARNING: Before buying this game, just know that this game is punishing - it's riddles are often hard to solve - though appear very easy in hindsight. If you're up to the challenge, this is the game for you!! 

I remember this game FONDLY on the NES, and spending hours on what could inevitably only take two hours to complete. Just be aware that this is a thinking person's adventure. Is it frustrating? Yes, but that's what makes it special. Just be sure to grab as many torches that you can find and THINK!!! An absolute brilliant game for those who want to spend their time thinking of every meticulous possible avenue of completion. A very rewarding game if you have the patience. a lot of trial and error here, but the pay off is grand. 

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198012221863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 254, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1408812920}
review: Let me be short on this: everything you loved about the original just about gets thrown out of the window in this poor excuse of a reimagining. I cannot recommend it at all, it feels like one of those dime a dozen casual games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017271295', 'num_games_owned': 1087, 'num_reviews': 483, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1447257142}
review:
Un mélange assez fadasse entre un jeu d'objets cachés et un diaporama d'artworks d'Heroic Fantasy. 

C'est peut-être parce que je n'ai jamais joué à la licence avant mais les aller-retours sont rapidement gonflants et l'interface ne fait qu'alourdir le rythme, déjà pas bien palpitant. 

Je suis certainement trop jeune pour apprécier ce genre de point'n click d'un autre âge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052372005', 'num_games_owned': 811, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 3509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3509, 'last_played': 1444953744}
review: not quite as good as the original i'd say, but it's still pretty good, and i am very curious about the sequel they hinted at, some puzzles are a bit iffy, i for example can't remember ever getting any clues as to what lever configurations actually did anything (those who have played the game already will probably know what i'm refering to). Still I'd recommend the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040144774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1441551164}

author: {'steamid': '76561198166853032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1446898519}
review: Oh hells no... more to final cutscene is just hype for shadowgate beyond in 2016.  I got the game to support the remake of classic games.   its more sad when its more like marvel does, use the current game to test the game engine and tweak it.  then let the "new" game come out after the first one was just really a beta.  blah... got it cheap for halloween sale, feel like i left something icky n sticky on my sheets n screen.   its not hard to playthrough, save your cash and just buy the trading cards.  blah... graphics and things are not 3d at all.. n64 graphics better, its just like a SNES cut out remake of the game.  some flashy bright grapics here and there but nothing worth the effort to make this game.   the map feature doesnt even have fast travel... snore...

author: {'steamid': '76561197963032117', 'num_games_owned': 864, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1447021510}
review: Nicely done! Reminds me of  Choose Your Own Adventure books.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051204305', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1423302863}
review:
Shadowgate, remake finanziato tramite kickstarter del classico omonimo del 1987, è una avventura grafica in stile Myst, ovvero prima persona e tante "stanze" da esplorare piene di enigmi, ad ambientazione fantasy.

La trama è abbastanza semplice, nei panni di un coraggioso avventuriero saremo chiamati a sconfiggere il classico Male di turno; di fatto, si tratta giusto di un pretesto per farci esplorare l'enorme castello, l'ambientazione principale di questo gioco.

L'anima classica dell'orignale è ampiamente rispettata: il gioco fa parte di quel filone di avventure vecchio stampo che non risparmiano mazzate sulle gengive al giocatore, sia per quanto riguarda i numerosi enigmi, spesso criptici e non immediati, sia per il pericolo di morte che si cela dietro ogni decisione sbagliata, decisioni che sono molto facili da prendere.
Senza contare che, visto che la vita del personaggio dipende dalla durata delle vostre torce, avrete un minimo di azioni in cui completare il gioco (che resta alto anche alla massima difficoltà, specifichiamo).
In questo remake, comunque, sono presenti diverse difficoltà con enigmi più semplici e un sistema di aiuti ben integrato per venire incontro proprio ai novizi e ai pelandroni.

Davvero ottimo il restuaro che ha subito il titolo, tutte le varie schermate sono state ridisegnate a mano con uno stile grafico davvero efficace, senza contare il lavoro sulla nuova colonna sonora integrata (che è possibile tranquillamente sostituire con quella originale).

Se siete giocatori pazienti che non si spaventano davanti al pericolo, in questo nuovo Shadowgate troverete una ottima avventura, piena di atmosfera.
Ne uscirete con le ossa rotte ma ne varrà la pena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062868414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1661398493}
review: Just as fun as back when I had it on NES. Recommended for anyone who loves a good puzzle game. If your not into games that make you think, this is probably not for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991059304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1550070084}
review:
An interesting game for those who are very into puzzle games, but i'm not greatly into them and the method of UI / transitions broke the deal for me, especially with the absurd amount of backtracking you need to do constantly. The hints aren't useful most of the time, so if you get stuck you end up having to find a walkthrough instead of the "hint" system actually providing "hints" on where to look next or whether a room even has anything of use anymore.

In the end, the game got me to go "fuck it" and uninstall when a particular part of the game decided to just undo some of my progress, forcing me to rerun a "puzzle" i had just done, all because another puzzle was locked behind this puzzle that required a clue in the far reaches of the levels. Travelling is a pain. Being forced to travel the same path three times after solving everything in your way is just terrible design when movement is already slow.

There's also a big negative that there's an explicit timer that starts early on and effectively voids your save if you don't get far enough. Since i used a walkthrough, that didn't affect me... but if you're the type to keep trying and figuring out puzzles all on your own, the game will literally force you to restart the entire game.

Overall, this game seems based on nostalgia. The art and voice acting is neat, but the story seems very barebones and typical "one hero destined to vanquish evil sent into some corrupted dungeon". If you do not mind the absurd levels of backtracking / poor navigation and enjoy point & click games you should pick this up, but for everyone else... maybe don't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055725979', 'num_games_owned': 1326, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 3116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3116, 'last_played': 1441214689}
review:
Somos el elegido y vamos al castillo de Shadow Gate sin persárnoslo. Después de un duro e intenso camino llegaremos a una entrada que parece ser un buen acceso para entrar en una catacumbas y acceder al castillo, porque algo se cuece dentro.

Es una aventura bastante compleja que está enfocada jugablemente a nuestra persona y nuestros actos. Tiene un humor muy bueno basado en los pensamientos de nuestro personaje para expresar textualmente lo que se le pasa por la cabeza, es una visión global de la gente, pero para nada pierde esa ambientación medieval de fantasía, están los dos ambientes  bien comprenetrados.

Al principio nos van a dar una libertad para que exploremos zonas y nos hagamos con el juego pero pronto veremos que esto se nos escapa de las manos si no lo afrontamos muy seriamente desde el principio. La aventura por una parte te brinda muchas facilidades, como por ejemplo un inventario ilimitado y una soluciones sencillas en la mayoría de los casos, pero por otra parte trata de acertijos y deducciones con una escala que se abre por completo a todo el recorrido del juego. Hacerse al juego es bastante dificil, muchas veces tendremos que pensar matemáticamente en las posibilidades del juego.

Los juegos como este siempre son agradecidos y, aunque resulten muy dificiles, siempre habrá guias en las que veremos todas las cosas que se pueden hacer y veremos como es el juego en realidad, siempre y cuando sea una buena obra como esta.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984505368', 'num_games_owned': 1529, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1444050277}
review:
I really wanted to like this - I like that old-school games are given a new coat and paint and return - I like the writing, artwork etc. but some of the puzzles are just MASSIVELY obscure and rely on random trial-and-error.

Worse still, trial-and-error is made harder by a truly awful/clumsy inventory system - it's genunely hard to tell if what you're doing is impossible or you were just clicking on SLIGHTLY the wrong place.

The key element for a game like this is guiding the player and making the process of solving puzzles intuitive and fun - not clumsy and frustrating.

Oh - and some of the puzzles are just nonsensical - nothing short of 'try everything on everything' will get you through - some things are just bonkers-stupid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142558807', 'num_games_owned': 1094, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2176, 'last_played': 1445190902}
review: When I heard about a remake of Shadowgate I got very excited.  I grew up playing the NES classic and loved everything about it.  This version didn't disappoint!  The updates to the old puzzles are very refreshing, lots are changed just enough to keep veteran players thinking.  Puzzles are also changed with each difficulty level and new ones are introduced adding a new twist to how you go about solving them.  Graphics and sound have had a major update to be expected.  I was very impressed with how the transition from the older game to the remake was.  All of the graphics have a hand painted style to them that give the game an even more dark mood than the original which fits the game very well.  Fans of the NES game will recognize all of the old music with an updated style.  There is even an option for listening to the old tracks while playing as well as making the game look and feel like the NES original.  To close, if your a fan of the original game or of adventure style point and click games in general you won't be disappointed!

author: {'steamid': '76561198033802030', 'num_games_owned': 2082, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 1024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1024, 'last_played': 1442250235}
review:
Summary: Adventure game with dead-ends
Multiplayer: No
Completion: 6 hrs
Cards: Yes
Cloud: No

I remember seeing Shadowgate for NES in magazines as a kid, and always wanted to try it out, but they never had it at my rental store. Now I get to have that chance, with much nicer eye candy. And... I must say it didn't disappoint, but it clearly is not a game for everybody. 

You take on the role of Jair. You want to beat the Warlock Lord. From there the story doesn't really get more complicated that that. It's pretty much your standard good-vs-evil tale. I would have liked some character development through dialogue. For example, there's a lady in a tower who would have been a good choice to converse with, but, well, that becomes moot pretty fast. Sure you become more powerful throughout the course of the game, but Jair never says anything short of grunts and tricks or treats.

Shadowgate comes from an era where dead-ends are both possible and common. I'm still against this design philosophy, but I can't totally blame them for wanting to keep the spirit of the original. Just be forewarned that it's quite possible to screw yourself over, so save often and in different slots. Speaking of which, I would have much liked the ability to name my save files. It gets kind of hard to tell which save is which..

Shadowgate boasts some very nice artwork, and is easy on the eyes. There's a fair amount of clutter in each scene, but I didn't have much difficulty picking out interactable objects, even without the use of F2. Retro graphics on the other hand is very harsh on the eyes. I recommend against using that, as it makes everything difficult to discern. I thought it would replicate the NES look, but instead it's like they took a mosaic filter and applied it to the screen. The music is pleasant, and fits the game quite nicely. It's never out of place and never obtrusive. Even better, the retro music works pretty well.

The interface is a tad on the clunky side. The inventory menu has a brief delay before you can interact with it, which is problematic when you need to access it so frequently. Thankfully you can set bindings, but that's more of a band-aid fix than a proper solution. The ability to use scroll wheel to go through items would have been nice. I suggest learning the keyboard shortcuts, as they will help speed up your progress in subsequent playthroughs. If you play the game entirely with the mouse, certain things feel remarkably slow.

There's 4 difficulty levels as of the time of this writing - Normal, Apprentice, Journeyman, and Master. I ended up playing through all of them in order, and I will say there's a pretty good progression. What worked once before might work differently in a higher difficulty.  I had the most fun with Journeyman difficulty which provides a generous time frame, but lacks puzzles exclusive to Master, which hampered the enjoyment a bit. Master difficulty on the other hand is overkill. I nearly failed both curing myself and beating it by less than 20 turns each. I thought I had a firm grasp on what I needed to do to win, but apparently not!

From Apprentice difficulty and higher (all the "Classic" modes), the game starts to institute hard time limits, primarily in the way of torches. You only have so many turns before your torch flickers out and die. Torches aren't too difficult to find, even on Master difficulty. In all liklihood, you will probably die to the other natural time limits set by the game, especially on Master difficulty.

Compounding the time limit problem is the abundance of items that do absolutely nothing. At least in Bethesda games you can sell all that junk you acquire. In here, the items serve to waste your time and nothing more. Unused items just makes the game feel unfinished. Yes I know they're red herrings, but they feel like an oversight, especially for the adventure game genre.

The game tries its darnedest to be as cryptic as possible sometimes. Most obvious case is in regard to spells. There's no way anyone would know what the spells do, as the game provides vague descriptions when you examine and cast them. And on Master difficulty you really can't spend turns casting spells willy-nilly.

Most of the puzzles in the game make... some amount of sense. The early difficulties are easy enough to figure out on your own, at least with the help of Yorick. The later difficulties I admit to using a guide. Many altered puzzles have solutions I didn't see clues for. When have I ever needed to make a green fire or get a wet cloak?

Overall I found Shadowgate to be enjoyable enough to sit through it through all difficulties. While I can't fault it for trying to be faithful to the original, I can fault the original for its curious design choices. If there's one thing I would have liked, it's the ability to play on Master mode without time limits, because I enjoyed the sheer number of things to see in there, but had no time to see all of it. I think Shadowgate falls into a 7/10.

EDIT: Bunch of spelling errors and grammar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074672646', 'num_games_owned': 6653, 'num_reviews': 596, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1439800004}
review:
[h1]Shadowgate est un jeu d’aventure avec des mini-jeux[/h1]

Ce jeu est aussi appelé Shadowgate 2014 puisque c’est une reprise du jeu original Shadowgate sorti en 1987.

Vous avez été convoqué (?) ou plutôt invité par un puissant magicien (Lakmir) à aller combattre un magicien malfaisant qui a pris possession de la forteresse de Shadowgate. Ce magicien malfaisant a déjà éliminé plusieurs autres magiciens envoyés par Lakmir.

Pour rendre les choses plus passionnante, dès le début du jeu, vous trouvez le moyen de vous faire maudire par un fantôme.

Regardez bien la vidéo. Personnellement, je trouve la réalisation du jeu plus qu’excellente. C’est vraiment un chef d’oeuvre et un plaisir d’y jouer.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=506533237

[url=www.graal.fr/2015/08/18/test-shadowgate-la-version-pour-steam/]Pour découvrir l’ensemble des mes impressions sur Shadowgate.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198041381333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1442082632}
review:
Lo recomiendo 100%, yo me lo compré en rebajas, pero ahora que lo he jugado puedo decir que merece los 15 euros qe vale de normal.
Es una aventura gráfica con el toque de los old school que tanto me gustan, de los que te hacen avanzar para luego retroceder. El estilo artistico del juego ayuda a la atmosfera oscura, recordandote al universo de el señor de los anillos. La narrativa está muy cuidada y ofrece descripciones de casi todos los elementos del juego, con esto me refiero a que si inspeccionas la pared aunque no tenga nada, te dice una breve descripción de como es su estado, cosa que ayuda mucho a que te metas en el papel y te sumergas más en el juego.

En definitiva, un buen juego que añadir a la colección.

review: I thought this was a classic dungeon crawling, puzzle solving experience, sort of like an offshoot of the early Fighting Fantasy books but in reality it's just a frustration fest full of zero-logic puzzles, tons of dead ends and gameplay that can only be appreciated by someone who used to love the original. Lesson learned, though - never buy games on day 1, no matter how good you think they are! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198134678166', 'num_games_owned': 551, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 846, 'last_played': 1511586618}
review: I bought this game on sale, so my opinion is a bit biased. The art and background music are great. The puzzles are hard and tricky. I had to consult guides at certain points, when I got too frustrated or impatient. But it was enjoyable. The story is pretty basic, good guy vanquishes evil guy, but sometimes it's nice to play an uncomplicated story. The game is certainly complicated though. This isn't a game for quick playthroughs or those short of patience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004313984', 'num_games_owned': 648, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 786, 'last_played': 1440366108}
review:
Shadowgate is a point and click/adventure puzzle game developed by Zojoi and published by Reverb Triple XP. Until recently, I had never heard of this title but apparently Shadowgate is one of the most well known point and click adventure titles in history. It was one of the original titles in the popular MacVenture series that went on to be celebrated on the NES, GBC, and Nintendo 64 so this game has alot of history behind it. This version of Shadowgate has been completely remastered by the original developement team from the ground up adding tons of new content to the game. The title thrusts you into the role of "The Seed Of Prophecy", a somewhat novice but "chosen" mage tasked with traveling to the living castle Shadowgate in hopes of defeating the evil that dwells within...the dreaded warlock lord.

Gameplay-wise, the title is presented in the first person perspective with a very minimal heads up display. Your character moves throughout the bowels of castle Shadowgate room by room searching for clues to aid you in your quest while also collecting items and trying to avoid death at the hands of traps, creatures and just plain stupidity. The various puzzles that you have to solve during your questing are the true high point of this game. You have to be keen to figure out many of these puzzles in order to advance the story and some of them will have you wanting to toss your keyboard through the nearest plate glass window. Beware as there will be some frustrating moments to be had in this game but that just makes the reward of solving the puzzles that much more enjoyable once you finally figure them out. Remember that sense of accomplishment that you felt in Dark Souls when you finally defeated that boss after the 103rd try? Kinda like that...kinda.

Graphically, this game is very beautiful. As I stated earlier, this is a remastered version with all new stunningly gorgeous handpainted artwork from beggining to end. The game interface is easy to use and highly customizable. The sound effects are extremely well done, very crisp and fit the title perfectly. The musical score is amazing. It changes depending on the situation and the place that you are inside of castle Shadowgate and does a wonderful job of immersing you within the title.

I was able to complete the game in just under 14 hours but of course I like to explore and backtrack so the typical gamer should be able to finish it in 10-12 hours. It's a short title but very enjoyable especially if you like this genre of games. This was my first dive into this category of gaming and it was a terrific experience that has me looking forward to playing more titles like this one. In fact, there is an available option that let's you turn on the retro version of the game so I definitely plan to go back and replay it in it's original form as soon as possible. When the next game, Beyond Shadowgate due in 2016, comes out I plan to be first in line to get my copy. This title is highly recommended to the puzzle solving adventure gamer or even someone just looking for a different gaming experience. Give it a try I don't think you'll be dissapointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064954707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1466972776}

author: {'steamid': '76561198047425832', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1440355464}
review:
Games like Shadowgate are for a very different demographic than mine - I kept this in mind when I bought it on sale, looking for a new gaming experience. I was hoping for something like an automated Dungeons and Dragons, which Shadowgate seemed to accomplish for me.

The main thing that caused me to give a negative review, is that when I found I was getting a hang of the game, and I had completed a side mission, a bug in the game (which others online have found no support for) caused there to be no result upon completion.

Pros
-Fantastic Art
-Atmosphere

Cons
-Many logical inconsistencies 
-Nonesensical means of progressing
-Even though it is "Point and Click", the controls are unnecessarily complicated 
(for every one click, you must click about 5 more times to accomplish something with your first click)
-The game mocks you for making incorrect decisions

author: {'steamid': '76561198008199689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1497577569}
review:
Pour ceux qui ont une heure à perdre, j'ai fait une review sur ce jeu.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sEAD9Gy4JHg


Pour les autres en version rapide alors.
Un excellent remake, digne de son prédécesseur sur NES, si vous aimez les points & clicks et les ambiances heroic-fantasy, vous pouvez y aller, vous ne serez pas déçu.
Dans les points forts:
- Réalisation au top, que ce soit graphisme ou musique, c'est nickel
- C'est un jeu avec du cachet. Il y a une vrai patte artistique unique. Ca rappelle un peu les graphismes des cinématiques de Guild Wars 2 mais en "différent"
- A quelques coquilles près, le jeu est relativement bien traduit en français.
- Jeu difficile qui ne vous tient pas par la main si vous jouez au plus haut niveau de difficulté. Le jeu est assez punitif mais c'est là tout le "sel" du jeu. Si vous baissez la difficulté, les enigmes seront bien plus simple et vous disposerez de plusieurs méthodes pour "passer" les enigmes.
- le vieux Shadowgate m'a été offert avec ce remake.

Points faibles:
- une interface un peu vieillote, il y avait moyen de faire plus simple, plus ergonomique. Au final, ce n'est pas très dérangeant, mais c'est juste qu'au lieu de faire deux clics, vous en faîtes trois là où le jeu aurait pu être plus "intelligent" dans son approche

Bref, continuez Zojoi, vous faîtes du bon boulot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115596356', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1439128376}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971703354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1438689808}
review: A game that could only be received positively by a fan of the original looking back fondly at earlier times with glasses so rose-tinted they could win Best of Show at an annual fair gardening competition. Some of the so-called 'puzzles' could not possibly be 'solved' save by utter luck, having no rational basis for the requirements placed on the player for using the interface. Embarrassing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970325872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1438112843}
review:
I liked it very much.
So far I have finished it on "Normal" Mode, which is the easiest of 5 modes (counting ironman).
I felt that the game gives a great sense of place, of "being there" and I was reminded of Dark Souls in that aspect (altough it´s a totally different mechanic of course).
Also it´s similarly eerie, and you can really die a lot (even though it wasn´t so bad on Normal).

All in all I really liked the athmosphere, the riddles were mostly logical but not too easy. I checked a walktrhough for one riddle where I didn´t succeed after two nights of play.

All in all recommended if you like the fantasy setting, adventure games or oldschool games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128093487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1808, 'last_played': 1437636074}
review:
[h1]SHADOWGATE[/h1]                      [i]AH non di diou...................quelle claque ce jeu !![/i]


[h1]Intro[/h1]
Shadowgate est le 1er jeu de la sorte que je fait.
Et bien j'avoue avoir TOTALEMENT accroché a ce jeu, malgré une certaine difficulté pour moi envers certaines énigmes  (oui parfois ce jeu es tres difficile, en tout cas pour moi, j'avoue que quelq'un m'a pas mal aider).


[h1]Graphismes/Décors[/h1]
Graphiquement, il y a un style que je qualifirait de  ''style aquarelle'', on croirait jouer sur une peinture, c'est tres agréable je trouve. Ceci dit, un chouya de details en plus ne m'aurait pas déplu, mais ca passe tres largement quand même.


[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
La prise en main est tres simple, il y a des raccourcis clavier tres utiles pour economisé du temps. Il faut chercher partout, mais VRAIMENT partout. Il faut parfois faire un retour au debut du jeu pour débloquer qque chose beaucoup plus loin, ce qui rend le jeu immersif car on scrute tout le decor a s'en explosé les yeux trop pres de l'ecran.
Le jeu est taquin...............oui oui taquin, car tout les objets recuperables ne sont pas forcements utilisables, ce qui fait marché les méninges a toute berzingue.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
Le seul et unique bémol a ce jeu, ce trouve être l'absence de voix francaises, d'habitude cela est pour moi rédibitoire quand a l'achat d'un jeu. mais les voix sont belles a entendres.
Alors [i]''pourquoi l'a tu acheter gros couillon''[/i] me direz vous.......................ben j'ai pas fait gaffe en fait hihi ^^
Et je dois avouer que j'ai bien fait de pas faire gaffe a cela, car je serai passer a coté d'un très très bon jeu.
Et je peut déjà dire que la suite je l'aurai pour sure !!



Alors oui je le recommande chaudement pour tous les aspects du jeu.


http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=486577099
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=486577148
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=486577795

author: {'steamid': '76561198013278787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1436900585}
review:
So, nach einigen Stunden spielen hab ich das Game nun durch. Ich gebe zu, dass ich es nur mit Komplettlösung geschafft habe, es ohne aber auch gar nicht erst bis zum Ende gespielt hätte.

Der Hauptgrund dafür liegt tatsächlich an den Rätseln und dem Gameflow. Man findet haufenweise Krams, danach kommt man irgendwohin, wo man nicht weiterkommt und kombiniert danach X mit Y solange bis etwas passt oder man frustriert weiterzieht. Während das am Anfang noch einigermaßen okay war, wurde es irgendwann nur noch lästig. Ohne die Komplettlösung wäre ich wahrscheinlich noch tagelang umhergeirrt und hätte verzweifelt versucht DAS eine Objekt zu finden, mit dem ich vielleicht Gegenstand XYZ noch nicht kombiniert habe, nur um dann zum nächsten Punkt weiterzulaufen.

Gut möglich, dass das Game für Hardcore Puzzle Fans super ist, für mich als Neuling war der Anfängermodus schon absolut abschreckend.

Ansonsten würde ich sagen, man merkt dem Spiel an, dass es ein Remake ist.

Grafik: 4/10
Sound: 4/10
Steuerung: 4/10

Fazit: Ich kann das Spiel leider nicht weiterempfehlen. Mir haben Spiele wie Indiana Jones - Fate of Atlantis, Day of the Tentacle, Sam & Max, Full Throttle,... und viele andere Point&Click Spiele mehr Spaß gemacht und waren erheblich weniger frustrierend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133405124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1437730395}
review:
An improved version of the classic Shadowgate.
I dont remember if the hint system existed in the original, but I feel I got stuck much less in this 2014 version.

If you like these point and click adventure games, I'm sure you will enjoy this game. The only downside I would give is that some of the puzzles are a bit too difficult, and by difficult I mean they are hard to logically put together so you end up trying everything in every room.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198000231311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1698616380}

As I found this remake on the web the classical medley from the past started to play in my head and I knew I have to beat it. Well, I didn't beat it yet but I got faith in me.

12/10 would buy it again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050896286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1634830619}
review:
I've never played any of the earlier Shadowgates, but this one is definitely recommendable.

Sure, it has the usual adventure hangups: don't know what to do next, don't know what the spells do, don't know what item to use here, can't find the info I need in my archives. The humor is weirdly out of place in this dark fantasy world, too - especially Yorick the helpful skull companion.

The game is a worthwhile experience, though. The writing is great, the graphics and effects are nice, exploration and puzzling are fun. There's replayability because the 4 different difficulty settings all change the game to certain degrees. 

Give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107888561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1440125135}
review:
Una aventura grafica como las de antes. Categoria que aveces se extraña. Observa bien las salas, toma los objetos y usalos correctamente en el momento adecuado. Busca, avanza, y resuelve los puzzles u objetivos. 
Luego nos encontramos con esta gran historia de ficción llena de magia enigmas y monstruos. Para mi otra gran categoría.
De este juego también me gusta su grado de dificultad. He jugado a otras aventuras recientemente y los objetivos son demasiado simples. Hasta el momento llevo algo más de 6h jugadas y estoy super encantado. 
Si te gustan las aventuras y los juegos de pensar y rebuscar te lo recomiendo. 
Por cierto, en Linux va genial ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198070123302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1436800431}
review:
A remake of a first person adventure game that originally looked a bit like an RPG. 

An enjoyable and (if you ignore the fact that it's set in a fantasy world full of magic etc.) so far pretty straight forward, first-person adventure game. No nonsensical (il)logic puzzles, although having said that, it was (save for Starship Titanic) generally always the 3rd person point'n'click variety that had that type of thing...

...Shadowgate has just the kind of stuff that's typical to first-person adventure games, but most definitely at the easier end of that continuum (nothing like Schizm or Rhem here (at least not so far)).

Reminds me a little of Zork Inquisitor (just without the overt humour) although having said that it does seem that much of its text could be read as being very subtly toungue-in-cheek (I'm not a fan of obnoxious, flip and glib commentary in video games and thankfully there's none of that here).

Altogether a very enjoyable game (if you're into 1st person adventures and aren't looking for something that's going to play like a graphically enhanced mensa test, as so many of the 1st person adventure games of the past have tended to do).

The biggest (and for me really the only) potential problem I've encountered so far is the possibility of overlooking relevant objects and actions (if you don't want to pixel hunt every node and be subjected to skimming the same descriptive text over and over again, which you would almost certainly have to do on the higher difficulty setting (and why anyone would want to play like that is beyond me. For me (outside of the crazy logic typical of the 3rd person point'n'click adventrures) that's the biggest flaw in the adventure game format.)). 

Thankfully there is a hint system and a button to reveal the hotspots and on the easier difficulty, all possible actions appear in the context menu when you click on each hotspot (one cavaet to that is that I have to say that (apart from Telltale's adventures) I don't think I've played a single adventure game that isn't incompletable due to broken design or glitchy programming. One can only hope that Shadowgate can be updated should that be the case here).

One criticism I do have, is the relatively poor quality of the sound-files. I've got an Asus Xonar Essence STX driving a mid-range 3-point speaker setup that staggered the reviewers for their quality within their price range. One common criticisms of my speaker setup was the quality of the trebble, and while, for the most part, it's more or less unnoticable, the sound that Shadowgate's pushing out of my speakers is sharp to the point of discomfort. It's the first time I've experienced this with my speakers and it almost sent me -- thinking there might be a fault somewhere in my setup -- reaching over to check my hardware.
         
I'm not sure why Shadowgate's sound should be as it is, unless for file-size convenience but I can only imagine that on cheaper speaker setups, or worse still, the kind of speakers that are built into monitors, Shadowgate's sound may very well, rather than just failing to enhance the game, be tinny enough to actually mar the experience.

My sound set up is capable of creating sound that envelopes and absorbs the player into it but Shadowgate's sound almost seems like it's doing its best to be impenetrable, to the point of almost feeling kind of repellent, and it's a shame. I wanted to turn the volume up and have Shadowgate's audioscape unfold around me, but unfortunately the quality was just not there. It would seem that with no size-restrictions in terms of limited CD or DVD space, games these days could have very full, very clear audio but unfortunately that just doesn't seem to be the case with Shadowgate. Maybe they just didn't want the sound to upstage the graphics, who knows...)

review:
*-Use- Wallet on Shadowgate.*

Congratulations! The game has been purchased!

*-Open- Shadowgate.*

As your index finger hits the left mouse button, the click heralds the release of a green cloud of smoke from the small apparatus. You burst into violent coughing and cover your face, but it is too late. Alas, your lungs melt from the inside out. It is a pity that your adventure has ended here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198234053152', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1588642415}
review:
If you are new to the world of Shadowgate I'd recommend getting this game and playing it, then once you beat it, go buy the original for Nintendo/Game Boy (cause you might not find it for the Apple Macintosh "MacVenture" series). I'm actually so glad they re-made it and if you can appreciate this game for what it is, you should be able to appreciate what Kemco had to work with back in 1987 as a point and click Adventure game! The game now has a more in-depth storyline, tricky puzzles and animations that were once still pixelated images of rooms in the Castle Shadowgate. If you enjoy point and click puzzle game apps on your smart phone, you'll definitely enjoy this game. If you are indeed new to this game, stop reading right here and ignore my critique of the pros and cons of the game else you'll forever curse yourself with many spoilers! I don't mean to spoil this game too much, but I'd like to share my concerns and thoughts with the community that have been waiting for this game to be re-made for so very long.

**SPOILER ALERT**

If you are already familiar with the 1987 Kemco Shadowgate realm, continue reading this scroll as it will disappear once you finished reading it! You won't learn any new spells, but you may either want to agree or disagree with some of the points I have to make about the re-make of the already awesome Shadowgate game by Kemco.

Now First off, I've got to say, I was a little disaappointed with some of the many things they left out of the game. Now, I'm a HUGE fan of the Classic game and I pay alot of attention to detail. So much, in fact, that I fashioned an entire map on Minecraft of a Shadowgate Replica with working traps and exact(: as much as Minecraft can provide) room structure. It took me a HELL of a long time to make. Now on to the pros and cons.

The Pros: (Simple and Sweet)
-Great Artwork and Animation (Beautiful done)
-Interesting use of Puzzles and New ones added (Alot the same as the classic but some new ones that boggled my mind)
-Beautiful Story telling (Got more out of the story than just being placed in a world where I have to kill a warlock lord)
-Improved versions of Songs used in the original (Feelings of Nostalgia once I played)
-Great new tip system (helped me out alot in situations compared to the original)

The Cons: (Now I know it's not the same game but I was expecting certain similarities and some were frustrating because it didn't make sense, but others are minor)
-Not all the rooms were re-worked (we're missing a few rooms from the original which were key to storyline)
-Enemies were placed in different locations (as well as some being left out or changed, it was exciting but also, I was expecting sharks instead of an octopus/squid. Also, the Goblin had to be punched instead of hit with a rock and slingshot)
-Alot of the story was changed (such as the Behemoth being attacked would result in death, the warlock lord being attacked would also result in death. I would like someone to explain to me, why the Elemental Spirits are "Evil" according to the hint given? Doesn't make much sense... Would have been alright if you used the staff of ages on the warlock Lord instead.
-Some music was left out (There were plenty of GREAT tracks in the classic Shadowgate, almost one for each room. Some of the rooms had the same track of the first room playing. I just think they should have kept the music of each room after re-working it, I bought the DLC with the soundtrack and I only admired one song which is the end credits due to it going through every track Shadowgate had in a guitar rock style. Other than that, the rest of the music is the same style, slow and creepy. Still good but I think they really could have done so many more orchestrations and I'm not sure what their reason is for not making more for the game.

So there, that's my thoughts on such a great game! Most of my cons were more towards a critical point of view but it still should not deter anyone (new or veteran) from buying and playing this game. Regardless of the Cons I give it a 5/5 for being re-worked and bringing this overly critical guy some Nostalgia. I beat the game in normal mode, I'm going to try the harder modes to see if maybe i missed something. I'll check back and possibly re-tract some of my Cons in the future. Enjoy this game!!! :)

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198154547741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1453601917}
review:
Beyond love this game!  I played the Nes version a few years ago and thought is was very well thought out with the puzzles and creativity.  

Decades later and here is the remastered version!

The story is very satisfying in the way you feel every time you get to the next part of the story after doing some puzzles that you  truly earned it.

The game is set up in three modes Easy, Normal, Hard.  The Harder the game the harder the puzzles.

The game is pretty much point and click.  You go threw dungeons and click the next screen, locate and find items, weapons, spells, and Ghosts/demons/etc  Make sure you have the right things equipped for the rooms ahead and use everything you got on everything in the room.  Smash Mirrors with hammers, Fight or avoid dragons, Smack a talking skull upside the head, steal all the torches you can get into your bag and talk to a really old wizard that will show you the way to kick an evil Warlocks butt!

PROS:  
The Art Style is fantastic
Voiceovers are done well
The Music is gripping.
The puzzles are done amazingly well and still stand up today.
You carry a talking skull named Yorik with you who helps you out in a jam or cracks jokes at your expense.


CONS:
The Person reading this thinks the game stinks because they are not good at puzzles.

Rate 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198015353508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1434703136}
review:
A significant historic learning tool. Did you know that in a world without electricity or fire everyone would be dead by nightfall? In the dark you can't walk about without your bones becoming hollow bird skeletons and suffering overwhelming vertigo. In the olden days people had to lie down by sunset or risk severe and/or fatal injury. With 8-12 hours of blind inactivity people began to lose consciousness in order to cope with the boredom. Thus sleep was invented.

If you don't believe this try standing on one leg in the middle of your room with your eyes shut.

Best torch simulator I've ever played.

I give it a solid 7 lit torches out of a possible 10 because I need the other three to survive the night.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990261986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1434338842}
review: I have mixed feeling about Shadowgate. I'm satisfied witht the graphics and audio and gameplay was good up til (for me) about 4 hours into the game playing on normal (not classic). To that point I had played withtout the need for looking anything up on the internet and solving everything myself (maybe using the hint system a couple times to move things along). I had figured the developers had learned their lesson about annoying garbage that plagued adventure games of the past. Then I encountered this game's Achilles heal: you get to a puzzle and can't proceed because you missed something you never even knew existed, don't know exactly what it is or where it is, and the only choice is having to go through every room in the game again until you hopefully find it. Very minor spoiler here of where this started for me: there's a crystal puzzle in this game and after solving it you're supposed to cast a spell on it to activate a bridge. Problem was, I never encountered this particular spell. It would be somewhat tolerable though annoying to then look at an online guide, though most guides out there seem be written for classic mode. And since the game isn't so linear, you'll have to read through those guides pretty well before noticing the solution. That wasn't the only time something like this happened (another instance  for example is the rune puzzle) and when the annoyances started piling up I found myself mostly just sticking to the guides to speed things up and get it over with. So that's when the game starts feeling more like work than play. So bottom line is that although I enjoyed it at first, I felt barely compelled to complete Shadowgate and ultimately can't recommend it. That being said, I got it as part of a bundle and more than got my money's worth and will be be paying the $2.99 summer sale special edition upgrade price so I can get the soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976028334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 330, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1433410834}
review: I liked Shadowgate, but it was too hard for me. At a certain point, I just had no idea what I was supposed to be doing or where I can go to possibly make progress. If you're up for a challenging game, then look no further. I even played it on the easiest, wussy setting. Essentially this is a first-person point & click adventure game set in a dark fantasy world. The story is pretty generic.The animation in the game is limited and it's mainly static pictures that move within the screen. The art style is all hand painted pictures and they look decent. The game took me around five hours to finish, but keep in mind I cheated my way through a lot of it. Shadowgate is a fun game that provides a very robust challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025495758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1846, 'last_played': 1453151120}
review:
I remember playing the first shadowgate way back when it first came out in 1987.  I was only 4 years old at the time, playing it with my dad, but I remember it quite vividly.  My dad and I had a great time with all of the MacVenture games when I was a kid, and I was very excited when I heard about the remake more than 25 years later.  

The new version does not disappoint.   It has everything that was fun about the old ones, with much nicer graphics(though still definitely not AAA level, they are quite charming in their own way)  and new puzzles.  While it definitely pays homage to its predecessor this is not just a nostalgia trip; This is a very solid adventure game that stands on its own merit.  I would recommend it to any fans of the point and click genre, irrespective of age or whether you've played the old versions.

One nice thing about this game compared to many other point and click games is that there are four distinct difficulty levels that  make major changes to what puzzles you will face.  This option makes the game accessible for novice/casual player while still providing a challenge for the most hardcore players.  Also, if you start on one of the lower difficulty levels, you can play again on a harder level and its almost like a whole new game, with all sorts of new items and puzzles.

If you are not into point and click adventures you probably won't be into this, but if you do like this kind of game this is definitely one of the better ones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005378126', 'num_games_owned': 701, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1432680176}
review: An additional game in the Shadowgate series , hailing back to the days when visual graphics were a new idea (point & click turn-based puzzler adventure fantasy game). It has nice graphics, puzzles, and music. The UI is easy to use and makes sense. This game might not appeal to modern-ascetics of how fantasy and adventure games are designed, but it's a nice revisit for gamer's that played the first one. It will also appeal to fans of the the point & click and puzzle genres.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048993979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1636295535}
review: I grew up with Shadowgate on the NES and I bought this becuase I loved that.  I may have only currently beat this on Normal, i still feel its worth the buy to anyone who liked Macventure in their early years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011352496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 760, 'last_played': 1464384980}
review:
Very brutal, challenging and rewarding adventure game for veterans.

Great narration, excellent watercoloured paint design better than the original 80's game.

Recommend playing this game on Master difficulty where the game will not hold back any punches on you this is basicly Dark Souls/Demon's Souls/Bloodbourne in a point and click game "YOU WILL DIE ALOT!".

If your a novice puzzle solver you can play this on the easy difficulty (if your a cry baby) but it nerfs the challenge in avoiding deaths, less puzzles, solutions will be solved for you, some puzzle rooms will be unloseable but that doesn't mean you won't die on easy mode because you still can from tons of trial and error.

But then again if your a novice you shouldn't start with this game I recommend Sam n Max, Monkey Island, Kings Quest 1 Remake or Leisure Suit Larry for great laughs and easier difficulty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025254064', 'num_games_owned': 1071, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2307, 'last_played': 1418674057}
review:
While the 2014 remake of Shadowgate reuses all the settings of the original, and many of the puzzles, and the story is basically the same, there is a massive plethora of new material. It's not a straight port with new graphics, it's a complete reimagining.

One thing my nostalgia wants to nitpick is that the atmosphere doesn't quite feel the same as the NES version, but I think that just might be difficult to recapture. It does, in many ways, feel like a hidden object game, only without the hidden object scenes. However, there are four difficulty settings, which add increasingly more rooms to explore and more complex puzzles to solve, and even the easiest one is harder than the hardest hidden object game I've completed. So, it is definitely a challenge for those familiar with the original, but many features (such as a new hint system provided by a talking skull named Yorick) make it accessible to newcomers. The multiple difficulty settings, plus the myriad achievements, also solve the "lack of replay value" that the original game had.

While the game wears its roots on its sleeve, which is good for hardcore fans, it also contains numerous pop culture references, some of them more appropriate than others. This also accounts for some of the difference in atmosphere between this and the original: The original seemed very much like it took place in its own world - the descriptions of lands beyond the castle itself created a great sense of the bigger picture. But all the references here project a mixed sense of being in a game world that somehow knows about things from unrelated properties. At least it has a lot of monsters , unlike Shadowgate 64, which had almost none.

Probably more important than the references are some of the story changes, particularly those involving the final boss, that longtime fans may or may not approve of. I'm not entirely sure of what to think of them, myself, and I was wondering if the final puzzle or ending would change at all on the harder settings to be more true to the original, but neither does. The remake also leans far more heavily into the horror genre. While the original had some gory death descriptions, the remake has some that are played out in cutscenes and are even far more disturbing than the worst ones in Uninvited. Not necessarily a negative point, just something you might want to be aware of.

The orchestral soundtrack is based on the melodies of the NES version, but there is also an option to use the actual NES chiptunes, which works surprisingly well.

All-in-all, this is a pretty strong recommendation, whether you're new to Shadowgate or not. Hardcore fans may not approve of all the changes, but there is still plenty of challenge and fun to be had. Even that elusive Goblin Room makes an appearance.

Rating: 4/5
