author: {'steamid': '76561198154909127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 912, 'last_played': 1429239235}
review: My first encounter with this game, was when the gameboy color and I remember having a lot of troubles to finish that game, but still I loved it. When I saw this remake and I saw the new art style, it brought me back and I wanted to play it again. I was not disappointed. Though I finish the Normal mode, which is hard but not much, If you select the Classic mode, it offers a more rich, long and hard story. It will make you think trying to solve the puzzles. If you don't use a guide it will be hard but very rewarding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115663978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1429117850}
review: I like retro games and I wanted to like this game, but it is cumbersome and missing logic in places. After  being stuck in the beginning rooms of the game, I decided to read through a walktrhrough guide to see if I am missing something. It turns out, a bunch of items are just not appearing and some things are already pre-activated a.s.o. With missing key items I can not get past the beginning rooms of the game. It is seriously bugged to the point where it is not playable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149611518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1643771513}
review: I love that they remade a classic game like this. I wish they would do more of these type games. I like the dark touch to the game.  It feels differently than the classic Shadowgate I played on NES, but I'll probably get used to it as I play it more, which I will.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135243422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1673065326}
review: Excellent reboot of a classic game. All the mystery, all the challenge of the original, with much improved interface, music and graphics. I have hoped for this game to be remade for over twenty years and here it is. I awaited the sale price just to be safe, and I have to say, getting this game for $4 was a TOTAL steal. I am so stoked. Get this game if you are a fan of puzzles, mystery, or fantasy/adventure. There is even a bit of horror thrown in nicely, just like the original.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081023501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1506345945}
review:
Having played the NES version of the game but never managed to even get out of the caves, this new version with it's strong narration and much more forgiving gameplay helped me see more of the depth of the story and experience the complexity of the puzzling castle once again.

If you liked ShadowGate for the NES but was put off by the constant start-overs, then you will love this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966530383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 930, 'last_played': 1428520400}

author: {'steamid': '76561198065640232', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1668470156}
review:
I was a player of Shadowgate back on the NES. I loved the game with a passion I can't put into words, but in an effort to be objective, I'm going to attempt to not let the rose-colored lenses of nostalgia influence me. 
This game is good...but it could have been better.

I'd recomment this game to those that played the original.
It offers a new look at the puzzles and traps that made the original so fun to play, but the archaic interface and play style will most likely not resonate with newer players, who expect epic storylines and an acceptable difficulty level.

Shadowgate is HARD. One mistake, especially on Master level, can spell death. If you love a challenge, and a dated interface is no problem for you, then try Shadowgate.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043655295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1497323355}
review:
I loved Shadowgate (NES). When I saw this on the Steam special I knew I had to grab it. It's been a frustrating adaptation of an already frustrating game. I would not recommend this game to anyone who is new to the series. It's system is primitive and a staple of the series but not for new players only old fans. 

The illustrations are beautiful though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042044990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1428806545}
review:
I haven't finished the game just yet but I just have to say this.  If you haven't bought this game yet, buy it now! 
I loved the old game and played it for hours as a kid, can't tell you the amount of fun i had playing this game back in the day and this is far from a money grab. They improved and changed alot, there is still some stuff there that helps if you had played the game previously, but not enough to prevent challenge to the game. I know some people are saying it's not as good because it can be clunky but in all honesty part of the challenge to the game back in the day was having to run around the castle. I feel that in the modern age of gaming people are becoming too used to linear games and quickly lose interest in anything that lacks that. I'm not saying it's their fault but games have changed from being a challenge based form of entertainment to a linear play through movie and if there isn't enough action to pull your attention for 75% of the game it then is labeled as "dry" or "boring" But the lack of linear game play is  refreshing for this old school gamer. There is plenty of challenge and a great atmosphere that reminds me of the old game and I have to say being a huge fan of shadowgate this is a great throw back to one of the games that made me love the fantasy and horror genre. Now if they could only find a way to fix that N64 game :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198014190035', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 686, 'last_played': 1425857099}

author: {'steamid': '76561198031396215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 793, 'last_played': 1698431366}
review: I kickstarted this out of fondness of the original. This one does not disappoint, great soundtrack, wonderful art work, and probably even more challenging that the original. There are plenty of nods to the original game. If you played the original, there will be a lot that is similar, yet different to you. Sometimes knowing the “correct” way something is supposed to go from the original will assist you. Sometimes it kills you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980504307', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1144, 'last_played': 1435713895}
review:
Full disclosure, I was a kickstarter backer of this game.

And I couldn't be happier.  It's an excellent point and click adventure, and holds up well to the original NES game I loved.

It also has a surprising amount of replay value, with the different difficulties.  There are non-trivial differences -- locations move, there are more monsters to deal with, puzzle solutions can change, etc.  I recommend playing the easy difficulty first, then replaying on higher ones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083304970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1939, 'last_played': 1454295659}
review:
A great example of how to do justice to a classic great point'n click adventure game of the past.
Wonderful art and music will draw you into it's engaging storyline that will challenge your wits.

Some nice graphic options to appeal more the players of the original game give you from the beginning the idea of respect of its roots.

For someone it could be strange to have difficulty levels in a adventure, but actually, even if the story is the same, the way you reach the ending is different.

What you thought being there, will be in another place or obtained in a more complicated way.
That if you begin with the easiest difficult.

However some puzzles aren't so a logic easy guess, especially speaking of those that make you get easter eggs or specific achievement and require a lot of trials.

Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999068755', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1536884764}
review: In my humble opinion, this has to be one of the greatest games of all time for Nintendo.  To see it revitalized and enhanced leaves me without words.  This is an excellent choice for gamers who want to experience remastered classics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150020975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 704, 'last_played': 1560932665}
review:
I never played any of the Macventure series until this one. It's really a great challenging puzzler (point and click) well thought out game. 

I can't really speak to verterns of the game since this is new to me, but I can say as a modern game this is great A++. Very good storyline, graphics and music. If you are like me and never played any of these games it is worth a try for sure.

There are 3 levels of difficulty so plenty of replay value, not to mention you can get the original MAC versions on Steam too if you want to play even more and check out the whole series of these games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053795222', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1649927128}
review: This blast from the past is a point and click puzzle adventure, where death is at every turn. With the atmospheric soundtrack, this living castle will test your mettle, and wits. Now go and become the hero you were ment too be!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971728316', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 822, 'last_played': 1424118977}
review:
I have never played Shadowgate before and completed the game on easy setting without using any guides, here are my thoughts:

Pro's

> Nice art work and immersive soundtrack.
> Challenging but logical and rewarding puzzles.
> Good storyline.
> Easy to use interface and inventory

Con's

> Some of the art wasn't so well done
> One or two puzzles that seemed a bit too cryptic
> A couple of annoying things such as lack of fast travel option and having to click out of the same text box each time you enter a room you've entered a 100 times before.

Overall: 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198104511357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1423186210}

author: {'steamid': '76561198174288755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1425309726}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988091166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1514475046}
review:
A classic 2D Adventure is reborn.

The oldest point and click series successfully arose after nearly 30 years! 
(stand up and applause, young whippersnappers!)

Enter a moist dungeon and figure out which dark wizard needs to get his prophesied magic spanking.
Yeah, they didn't bother with the academy award for originality back then.
If that's a problem, definitely pass on Shadowgate!

Otherwise, stay for the beautiful graphics. 
Puzzles are solid, thick, tight.
Music and sfx are flat out fantastic!

Generally, the whole atmosphere is captured brilliantly. 
I yawned in Myst and Riven, but there's something to be said about running out of torches while there's grunts and hisses coming from foreboding caverns in front of you.

A whole bunch of difficulty settings will accomodate everyone from casual coffeesippers to l33t mousebenders.
Highest difficulty will produce a LOT of oldschool deaths by dragonfire, deathly darkness or defenestration.
The interface looks clunky at first, but theres options to speed it up.


-verdict-
4 ancient prophecies out of 5 turned out to be true!
Maybe the best pure dungeon adventure?
If the premise is boring for you, it will deliver ... boredom! 
So it's definitely a genre thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085367707', 'num_games_owned': 779, 'num_reviews': 372, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1422766671}
review:
Shadowgate é uma versão reimaginada do jogo de mesmo nome lançado no final dos anos 80. É diferente o suficiente para fazer o jogador quebrar a cabeça ao resolver os novos puzzles, mas semelhante o bastante para trazer boas memórias para quem jogou as versões antigas.

O jogo diz respeito a um mago senhor das trevas que pretende subjulgar o mundo ao invocar uma força misteriosa contida em uma câmara secreta. O jogador é escolhido e guiado através das muralhas do castelo para derrotar o mago e impedi-lo de concretizar seus planos.

A história é instigante e bem explorada através de cutscenes e pequenos fragmentos de texto encontrados durante a jogatina, mas por vezes, as palavras arcaicas e forma de escrita rebuscada podem dificultar o entendimento por não nativos, já que o jogo só está disponível em inglês.

Os puzzles são, no geral, muito bem feitos e desafiadores, mas alguns deles são bitolados em uma só solução, de forma que se tornam injustos. Por exemplo, um objeto não quebra com martelada, daí você imagina que a solução não é quebrar, e fica dando voltas e voltas até descobrir que tal item só quebra se bater com a mão...

Uma coisa legal é que foi incluída a possibilidade de se jogar com as músicas, texto e transições originais da versão anterior de Shadowgate. Há também uma forma clássica dos controles, mas ela é semelhante à versão antiga para Mac, e não a versão para NES que foi a que eu joguei.

No geral, Shadowgate é um grande jogo que faz jus a memória de seu antecessor e superou minhas expectativas de um mero remake. Recomendo a todos que apreciam o estilo. MUITO BOM (8/10).

author: {'steamid': '76561198005426490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1428785873}
review:
Stylish and challenging adventure game that stays true to the original.  

If you feel like combing through pictures for details, writing notes, and solving challenging puzzles, this game is probably right for you.  It is also quite enjoyable using a walkthrough for a leisurely run.  The story, art, and the way everything was put together is very high quality.  One of the best of its genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021837454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1426345497}
review: This is a really nice remake. Especially the soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085050806', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1448946247}
review: It was a super long time ago when I played the original Shadowgate. I was a kid then and I shouldn't have been playing t hat game. Once I turned a teenager I played the original and I beat it. It was fun but at that time the PS2 was out and I wanted more graphcs and more storyline. When I saw that they made Shadowgate 2014 I lost my mind. I have been waiting for a long time to play an undated version of this game and when I bought and played it. I was not disappoiinted in it. It reminds me of the old only with updated graphics and puzzles. I think this was a great idea and I love what they have done with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102102490', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1660449646}
review: If you're a fan of point-and-click games or horror in general, Shadowgate will definitely appeal to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018514111', 'num_games_owned': 3257, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 1552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1552, 'last_played': 1506542932}
review:
This was pretty good. The hard time limits are a pretty terrible way to challenge a player – Shadowgate except everything gets faster – and some of the puzzles on the tougher difficulty settings are just … what… but I certainly felt I had my money's worth, despite some of that being using random items on other random items just on a prayer.

Remember to turn on the retro transitions, because the game's regular ones are a bore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003966679', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 766, 'last_played': 1454449337}
review: Beautiful art, epic soundtrack (literally!), charming sense of humor and challenging point and click puzzles. It's great!

author: {'steamid': '76561198153998065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1422340054}
review:
All of the nostalgia comes flooding back in a huge current of awesome. As a huge fan of the NES version (and the series in general), i find this remake to be amazing. Its everything the original wanted to be and couldnt due to restraints. Its expands on the lore, gives shockingly decent voice acting for cut scenes, expands on original puzzles, and does away with some of the less intuitive puzzles of the original. The music remastering is wonderful. You'll hear some of the old school tunes, only in a different way. It just feels more complete. The difficulty modes certainly will add to the replayability. 
Way to go on the changing around of the werewolf puzzle! Yes!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005267303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1422337036}
review: Awesome game it feels like the old classic that I sat and watched my sister and father play when i was little. I still own the nes cart.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023668268', 'num_games_owned': 4903, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 1527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 808, 'last_played': 1578829383}
review: Are you a fan of old school, no-holds barred adventure games? Do you love fantasty and beautiful artwork? How about a challenge? If you answered yes to these questions, you owe it to yourself to check out Shadowgate! The classic is back and better than ever!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970585953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1426125545}
review:
Fan of the Genre and lived the old Shadowgate which came out 30 years ago
sure takes me back, the dev have done a very good job to bring an old game back  to a newer better game
well worth to buy for any old vet fan of the genre

author: {'steamid': '76561198156943656', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 662, 'last_played': 1558751778}
review: A Faithfull remastering of the original shadowgate. Shadowgate 2014 greatly expands upon the original in all areas of the game: graphics, sound, story, and gameplay. For those that have played the original shadowgate 2014 is loaded with new puzzles and lore. For those  that havent played the original this game offers a great veiw of what games used to be like before the AAA's controlled your fun. Be ready to think carefuly and save often; while you can use your torch on yourself only you can decide if you should.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022632674', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 745, 'last_played': 1583375819}
review: Very well done point and click adventure albeit a tad short. Could have used a bit more puzzles but overall a satisfying experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971763113', 'num_games_owned': 497, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1420405702}
review:
I really enjoyed shadowgate on the nes so I was really looking forward to this game.  Now I don't know if it's just because games have gotten so much better these days or what but I just found myself not overly enjoying this one.  I dont remember the old one having so many arbitrary spells needing to be figured out what they do and such.  It also seemed like there was a huge ammount of items that were never even used.  Maybe I just needed to play on a harder difficulty I dont know(I played through it on apprentice).

  I also remember having to deal with a troll on a bridge and some riddles and that was totally skipped over on this one.  I think instead of buying this I would recommend getting an emulator and grabbing the nes one, or if you can find a copy and a nes then go that way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162538748', 'num_games_owned': 607, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 838, 'last_played': 1420195801}
review:
【影之門】是我小時候玩這款遊戲時的中文名稱。沒想到經過了二十多年，居然有了重製的版本，真是太懷念了。重製版保留了跟舊版一樣的玩法，仍舊是採用一張一張2D圖片，點擊解謎，畫風很有老遊戲的味道，新版配樂也很不錯。

這款遊戲從以前到現在，就是一個難!  難是他的特色。

對沒有玩過的玩家，他的難有這幾點 (新舊版都一樣) :
[olist]
[*] 你會死，而且死很多次。所以你要時常存檔。
[*] 你需要火把，否則你會死，而火把是會熄滅的，火把的數量也有限，這意味著你只有有限的行動次數。
[*] 你在前半段的時候，就會被惡靈詛咒，若不找到解除詛咒的方法，你會死。所以遊戲前半段的第一個大目標，就是解除詛咒，而你的時間有限。不少玩家對這一點很感冒，不過，這已經是這個遊戲的特色了。我想若是再出下一版，這一點大概也會繼續被保留吧!
[*] 遊戲內有不少不重要的物品，或是沒用的物品。這會增加你嘗試的負擔，導致你的死亡。不過新版中，很多物品，雖然不是主線破關必須的，卻是其他支線謎題所需的。
[*] 因為以上幾點，所以你時常會在許多不同的時間點存檔。當嘗試了很多很多步驟，用掉很多火把，終於得到一些進展後，就要讀取以前的數據，用正確步驟再來一次。這款遊戲你是可以存很多slot的。
[/olist]

新舊版有什麼不一樣呢?
[olist]
[*] 新版有三個難度可以選擇。每種難度的謎題解法會有差異。難度低的火把多且火把時間也長。
[*] 雖然有不少房間是跟舊版一樣，但是大多數的謎題都不一樣了。所以舊版的解法可沒多大用處喔。只有少數解法是一模一樣，應該是給老玩家回味的。新版還多了不少新的地方可以探索的，主要在後半段的地方。
[*] 新版的 Inventory 可以放很多很多東西，應該是沒有限制了。不像舊版東西不能放太多。
[*] 新版的魔法是看卷軸學，學會就可以無限制使用。不像舊版只能用一次。新版本魔法數目也比舊版多了不少。
[*] 新版除了主線謎題之外，還多了不少支線謎題。不少成就跟這些支線謎題有關。
[*] 多了提示系統。不過若你選的難度高，提示就越隱晦，用處越少。
[/olist]

若你以前就喜歡Shadowgate，那麼這一款更是必買不可。
新玩家若喜歡挑戰困難的謎題，也非常建議入手嘗試一下這款骨灰級的經典遊戲。

author: {'steamid': '76561197999162473', 'num_games_owned': 448, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1493075797}
review:
I hate to do this, because I grew up with the classic Shadowgate on the NES and loved it, but this game just isn't as "good" as the classic.

When I first saw this in the store, I thought that it was going to be a remastery with better graphics and some of the more obtuse puzzles refined to the point where they make more sense.

What they actually did was re-imagine most of the entire game, changed a ton of the puzzles, changed how a bunch of them worked and put in a LOT of back tracking into the game.

The classic game already had a standard "timer" with the torches that didn't allow you drag your feet all day, but it was spaced out enough to the point where the system was "fair". Not only does this game still have that timer, but worse, they enforce a mandatory curse that will end your game every time unless you can solve it. I don't know what they were thinking, but it was not an intelligent design decision. 

Let me tell you something, when your biggest selling point is the nostalgia your game generates, the last thing you want to do is change the game so much it is no longer recognizable.

This isn't Shadowgate and frankly I am offended by what the developers did here. They ruined this game. I hope they NEVER get around to working on any of the other classic titles or they'll most likely just ruin that as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009651136', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1421098992}
review: Shadowgate offerred exactly what I was looking for: a dungeoncrawling adventure "narrated" as if a DM was describing the events to you, where you must rely on wits, not combat, to progress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070480746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 916, 'last_played': 1422085278}
review: It would be a great game, but there is a bug with the Spire Key on the Master level that makes the game unplayable. Will recomend if they fix this but for now it's a broken game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034430262', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1490393242}
review: The Classic Returns....

author: {'steamid': '76561198166840000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1704, 'last_played': 1701371902}
review:
Shadowgate ist vor allem für Leute interessant, die es aus den 90ern auf dem Amiga kennen. 

Ein Minuspunkt ist, dass das Game schwierig ist, sodass viele es ohne Hilfe von Lets Plays letzten Endes nicht zu Ende spielen können. 

Das Spiel hat imho aber etwas geniales und vermag es, einen User lange zu faszinieren. Ich habe es mehrmals durchgespielt. Man kann den Zauber dieses Spiel schlecht in Worte fassen, es fühlt sich irgendwie magisch an und bringt eine eigenartige Einheit zwischen Spiel und Spieler, auch wenn es eigentlich vom Gameplay her nicht mehr zeitgemäss ist. Das spielt in dem Fall aber keine Rolle. Shadowgate 2014 ist das Remake eines alten Spieles und die Macher haben etwas wunderbares daraus gemacht. Grosses Lob!

Spiel ist aber komplett in Englisch. Auch keine deutschen Untertitel. Wörterbuch ist also vonnöten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068090056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 769, 'last_played': 1567973889}
review: Voyez vous shadowgate a tout le temps rentrer dans mon top cinq de mes jeu classic preferer. J'ai a jouer a shadowgate toute ma vie, de l'age de 6ans quand ce jeu me fichait la trouille a l'age de 16 aujourd'hui (qui me fiche encore la trouille XD). J'ai acheter cette version de shadowgate pensant quil serait pareille comme celui precedent sur NES, mais j'ai eu tort ma foi... cette version est INCONTOURNABLE si vous avez aimez les version precedente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001669134', 'num_games_owned': 830, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1707169160}
review:
Вошел в комнату, увидел дракона, подобрал пару предметов, тот спалил меня и я умер.
Пошел в пещеру, там летает ледяная НЕХ, тыкнул в нее факелом, она меня заморозила и я умер.
Захожу в замок, выскакивает гоблин, я потянулся за мечом, тот всвдил мне топор промеж глаз и я... ну вы понели.
10 из 10.
Хотя нет, на пару баллов сбавлю за корявую оптимизацию - отчего-то это чудо рисованное тормозит порой похлеще Круизиса, но поскольку игра походовая, то это вызывает лишь легкое раздражение.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035410367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1597255265}
review: Fantastic game. It took me about an hour to get used to the interface and figure out what to expect from the game, but once I got used to it and started enjoying the story and puzzles, it turned out to be one of the best adventure games I've played in a very long time. I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027918275', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1420451961}
review:
I did not enjoy the adventure/puzzle aspect of the game I just did not find it interesting or fun, it's not as hard as it is obtuse its more about exploration than anything else. I didn't like that there is just a ton of going back and forth and the game has 100+ rooms if you think about it the game is just a corridor of rooms you go up and down over and over. Then with the pick-ups the vast majority of them do nothing and are just there for flavor. Surprisingly there are not a lot of items needed to beat the game. I suppose the difficulty is primarily based on your time limit more than puzzles but I find that just makes the game more annoying because then you have to restart completely if you run out of time.

What I do consider good about this game is that they built a world because there is just so much stuff that has nothing to do with the solution there are even side-quests and many things that you will not see if you only stick to the path. There is still a problem with that though because its a time limited game I don't feel that the exploration aspect really fits though I do applaud the fact that it is there. 

The extra difficulties are nice as well, especially since they made the puzzles different, so playing on higher difficulties changes the game slightly. Unfortunately I don't find the lower difficulties to be necessary. They are too easy and master difficulty is not any harder just "longer" by a few steps here and there. I think there's a stigma that this game is super hard and they tried to reinforce this with the difficulty levels but starting at anything below master is really just a waste of time.

In closing I also want to say I was a bit disappointed in that there were not as many deaths as I thought there would be because I thought that was a big part of the game. I might have fallen from a few things or gotten shanked by some goblins but nothing I didn't see coming. From what I understand most of the deaths, or at least the good ones, you have to actually try to find. If you stick to solving the game though you will not die very often or at all which is the opposite of what I was expecting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031136337', 'num_games_owned': 575, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1421015267}
review: 295 DEATHS IN VAIN WOULD VENTURE AGAIN

author: {'steamid': '76561197964482683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1420324440}
review: Another terrible adventure game you would have to brute force your way through to make any progress in without resorting to a guide.  Nostalgia is keeping its review ratio unreasonably high.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039363696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1173, 'last_played': 1420272001}
review:
Challenging while remaining logical; after figuring out the solution to what was stumping you, you'll wonder why you didn't think of it sooner.

Some of my favorite rooms and puzzles from the original Shadowgate were unfortunately not reimagined here, the way others were.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963917985', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1420140407}
review:
Shadowgate may or may not be a thing that you remember from the past. If you do remember it, there are several possible versions across different platforms that you may remember. The version of Shadowgate that I remember is the NES version. I never owned the game, but I rented it a few times and enjoyed it. When I saw that someone was remaking it, I had to check it out.

For the most part, the 2014 remake of Shadowgate is faithful, while also being respectful in its adaptation. This isn't a 100% translation. While some things you may remember from the past are still present in this version of the game, others may be absent or changed, while new puzzles and features have been added. The spirit of what made Shadowgate great is intact however and that's what's most important.

It would be easy to quibble over the changes and additions made to this version of the game, but ultimately they are no better or worse than what was in the game to begin with. Certain puzzles still require odd leaps of logic and certain connections sometimes feel a bit stretched, but I've experienced worse and in the context of the game world it's forgivable. Ultimately I enjoyed Shadowgate and the addition of difficulty levels (with differing puzzles and win conditions) and achievements for time and turn limits, mean that there's decent replayability here. It's a classic game remade well and worth checking out. I'm looking forward to the next offering from this team.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027007978', 'num_games_owned': 531, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1420154656}
review:
Shadowgate has a nice atmosphere which is achieved by competently drawn backgrounds with small animations here and there and some pretty good music. The puzzles are logical and you get as many hints as you want (or need) to solve them. 

Unfortunately, the game is quite short and shortly before the end, you have to do a little fetch quest with a lot of backtracking. I would advise against doing longer breaks between game sessions because of this. Otherwise you may have trouble remembering every place you have been that had the required items you have to collect. 

Recommended if you can get it for cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166628124', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1468367581}
review: game fricken rocks......nuff said

author: {'steamid': '76561198065220925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1420053269}
review:
well crafted story with beautiful artwork to support it. The mechanics or many puzzle solving parts where well done but you should really understand what type of game this is as it's not for everyone.
The biggest flaw was the interface, as it does not like you and hence you do not like it. Especially bad in a game constructed as an interface.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986301824', 'num_games_owned': 1235, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 834, 'last_played': 1547302485}
review:
日本人にとってはケムコが翻訳したファミコン版でおなじみ、伝説的アドベンチャーゲームの公式リメイク。現代風グラフィックは好みが分かれるかもしれないが、リメイクとしての出来は非常に良質である。

リメイク版ならではの特徴はまず難易度が四段階になったこと。
（※Normal x1とClassic x3に分かれているが、実質的に地続きの四段階）
低難度では死亡選択肢が減るだけでなく、重要性の低い部屋やアイテムが省略されるなどかなり大胆な改変が入る。もともとこのゲームは大量の死亡パターンが変に話題を呼んだだけで、当時でも理不尽さの少ない良作とされていたのだが、その雰囲気を殺さない良調整といえる。

一方難易度を上げていくとかつての歯ごたえが帰ってくるわけだが、このとき同じ謎でも解法が変わったり全く新しい場面が増えたりするので、最大で四周は新鮮さを保ったまま遊べるのが嬉しい。加えて「○○を全て見つけ出す」系のやりこみ実績も豊富なため、レトロアドベンチャーゲームの弱点であるリプレイ性の低さが補われており、価格に対する満足度比も高い。それでいてエンディングを一度見るだけなら原作準拠の適度な長さにおさまるので中だるみもなく、ボリュームとリプレイ性のバランスがよくとれている。

必要な英語力はそこそこ。行動に対するメッセージだけならさほど難しくないのでパズル感覚で遊ぶこともできるが、巻物の形で散らばったフレーバーテキストを全て理解しようとするとさすがに骨が折れる。とはいえ古文バリバリというタイプではないのでその点は大丈夫。
原作スタッフが監修しているだけあってフレーバーは十分厚く書き足されており、原作プレイ済みの人も初めての人も違和感なく入り込めるはず。カットシーン頼みの演出面などにはやや安易さを感じないでもないが、全体としてはかなり高評価をつけられる作品。

author: {'steamid': '76561198052423353', 'num_games_owned': 552, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1447441412}
review:
An enjoyable point-and-click adventure with some replayability due to secret side-stories that are not needed to complete the game on the first run and the increasing difficulties. For Mac-users the interface is not as smooth as the pc version and in some spots it becomes and issue (The Footbridge for example needs you to press "G" to cross it , whereas in the pc version the commands are more visible).
Overall, an easy point-and-click adventure with the traditional dungeon-crawler adventure story. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198004453394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1419992333}
review:
I really liked this game, though it has one major downside that might drive some people crazy.  I've just finished my first run through of it on "Normal" mode (which has to be considered easy mode by the looks of it - possibly even in comparison to the easiest of the retro modes), and I completed it in one session.  

I was only stuck once or twice, and sure enough it was largely down to me not noticing things I should have noticed.  I will say that in 2 areas this was not the case though;  one scene involving mirrors did not work correctly until I saved and re-opened the game, the other major issue there was a pumpkin based puzzle (a side mission) I could not complete.  I even watched a playthrough of that section to make sure I had done everything correctly, and it simply wouldn't work.

The main gripe I had though, and the one major warning I'll give anyone reading this, is that the controls are horribly old fashioned.  I ended up using the keyboard as all the clicking to do simple tasks was doing my head in.  An example with the keyboard would be as follows (same thing with clicks but you need to keep moving the mouse to different icons as you go):

Task - use an item on an object in the scene
1 - Press I to open inventory
2 - Press U for Use
3 - Press I to close inventory
4 - Click on object you wish to use it on

If you wish to use the object on multiple items, you need to do this every single time.  Sometimes it doesn't register properly either.  This was a major frustration for me, seeing as this is a point and click adventure game.  I know they were going full retro, but they could have implemented something in there to cut out a hell of a lot of clicking.  

With that said I still recommend this game, if you can get it on sale.  It is a fun adventure, with a so-so story, pretty images, and some puzzles that will make you scratch your head.  I'm guessing the harder modes are an awful lot harder.

The issues I've mentioned keep it from being a full price recommendation.  Only get it if you think the controls wont drive you mad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045370126', 'num_games_owned': 892, 'num_reviews': 609, 'playtime_forever': 1706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1582, 'last_played': 1428394880}
review:
[h1] very good . ★★★★★☆[/h1] 
英語のみ/実績60/カード対応

あのクリックアドベンチャーのシャドウゲート（神ゲー）がリメイク。
シャドウゲートといえば、他のクリックアドベンチャーにない個性豊かなテキスト。ダークファンタジー。雰囲気がすばらしいゲームです。

COMMANDS/AUDIO/TEXTをレトロに変更可能。絵はドットからウェット感のあるペイント画になってます。
難易度は、新しく追加されたノーマル（命の松明の火が消えない）・クラシック（見習い・中級・マスター）。難易度が上がるごとにアイテムの位置と数が違います。謎解きも難しくなります。
途中から、オプションでリメイクとレトロと切り替えいつでも可になってます。結構、音の質は上がってるような気がします。
ＦＣ版とアイテムとかが違うところがたくさんあって驚きました。
ノーマル最短距離クリアーすると１時間ぐらいの内容ですが、やりこみ要素も多くて、難易度によって謎解きが少し違ったりして面白いです。実績解除好きにはいいではないでしょうか。
クリアーした後も、あのＢＧＭが耳に残りました。

悪い点を上げるとしたら、ＦＣと比べて画が表現しすぎ。
それと、グラフィックレトロはぼやかしただけ。よくない。
あと、日本語非対応。

でも、元がすばらしいのでsteamのリメイク版をぜひ開発していただければと思います。
それと英語のみなので、英語苦手な場合は日本語化ができるようになるまで待つのが吉。

実績に関しては、ほかのゲームと比べて難易度が高いです。
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
追加：２０１５/０１/２９：ＰＣクラシック版がおまけでもらえました。

author: {'steamid': '76561198052386141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1419934527}
review:
ファミコンで死にゲーとして有名なシャドウゲートのリメイク。
現代人向けに死にポイントを少なくしたノービスモードと、謎解きの難易度やアイテムの多さが変わる3つのクラシックモードがある。
ノービスをプレイした限り死神に会うこともほとんど無く、謎解きで詰まったところはあったものの適宜攻略をカンペしたりしてクリアできました。
音楽やコマンドはレトロ調のものに変更可能。
ただし、グラフィックだけはリアルバージョンしか無いので若干違和感がある。
ほとんどファミコン版と変わらない印象だが一部謎解きはリメイクされており、プレイ済みの人でも新鮮に楽しめると思います。
全編通して英語なのである程度英語力は必要。

author: {'steamid': '76561197990149368', 'num_games_owned': 1955, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1419906292}
review:
I honestly thought it was boring and the puzzles overly convoluted without actually being well designed. The art was good, the music was good, but the game just wasn't "there" for me. Barely anything in the game is there for a reason, fluff for your inventory littered around, dragons and goblins left unslain, and something that feels as though it ends a little too early. 

I'm honestly surprised this game doesn't have more negative reviews, but I guess there must be that nostalgia bias for a lot of people.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973379044', 'num_games_owned': 2600, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1462117878}
review:
Shadowgate.  I bought it for $9.99, and that is 10 dollars of happiness.  If you grew up playing this or had rented it more than a few times as a child -> you simply owe it to yourself to play this remake.  Back in the day it required repeated rentals, just to figure out how to beat it.  There were no guides and/or internet access to reference or help you on your way (unless you had Nintendo Power - which I did, but I don’t recall them having a guide).  

If this speaks to your childhood in anyway, then I urge you to play this version.  What you will find here is the  same classic game, given new life; a marvelous update on an old gem.  The graphical over hall is well imagined, the art is beautifully illustrated, and the experience is well received.  Good work

Buy it and remember....

author: {'steamid': '76561198011457032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1419628703}
review:
This game enthralled me long enough to finish it on normal mode and I purchased it at a discount, so I'll be fair and give it a "thumbs up". There are quiet a few things you should consider if you plan to buy this, though:

- It's not an RPG in any way regarding skilling, equipping or upgrading your character. You don't have skills, attributes or whatsoever you could manage or upgrade. You can't buy or sell items and all items you find in the game are basically "use item x for adventure element y (e.g. use the only arrow you'll find in the whole game against precisely one specific enemy).
- There are no fights in the classical sense. You don't aim or use skills or the like against enemies. You use item x, which is specifically designed to be used in this "fight" on the enemy or another item to win the fight. 
- There are some clues about what to do, but like in most adventures, you'll end up several times with spamming item x or ability y on everything you can to see if it has any effect. I felt really lost during the late game when I was just running around and trying to figure out where's the chance to progress with the game.
- There are NO, I repeat, NO possibilities for alternative ways to get around a challenge. You either stick to the scripted plan of using item a on element b in situation c after you've accomplished event d or you are srewed. That's actually the reason why adventures died out some time ago.
- I needed 6 hours to finish the game. That's a pretty short time to play through a game. You can choose to play the game on different difficulties, and I've read that some puzzles are different then. Nonetheless, I consider the replay value of this game to be like the reeat value of a pizza. 

If you've played the original Shadowgate (and liked it) or if you're a huge fan of fantasy adventures, you may give this game a try. All others should really think about if they really want to play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992390729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1419146654}
review:
This brings back so many great memories and experiences playing the original Shadowgate on my Atari ST. This is such a wonderful recreation of the original game, yet it adds so much more without spoiling the feel of the original at all, it just adds to it so beautifully. If you're a fan of the original or if you enjoy point and click adventure games, this is such a great game for you. I'm so happy this game finally got such a well deserved and well done remake.

I'd love to see more remakes/reimaginings of some other great point and click adventure games from this era like Deja Vu or Uninvited. Those would be insta-buys for me for sure. Oh man, I'm getting chills just thinking about playing Uninvited redone like this. I'll cross my fingers that that happens...

author: {'steamid': '76561198011334989', 'num_games_owned': 784, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1416809674}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988921262', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 878, 'last_played': 1612150946}
review:
Two people will play this game: 1.) Those who want the achievements and use the internet, and 2.) Those dedicated to discern the different ways to proceed/fail and skewer a dragon or become shish-kabobbed and flambéed by a fire drake. This game will test your mettle in wit, not how fast you can dodge, jump, twist and/or somersault. This is pure gameplay in terms of survival using your intelligence, not your elite gaming skills al a Mario, Sonic, Master Chief or Samus Aran. This game will confuse you. Corner you. Disuade you from pushing forward. And you will die. A lot. But that is okay, because what you will also do is relish in your achievements as you figure things out for yourself and not rely on the internet for the answer. This game is not so hard you will break a keyboard, but it worth every penny for what it is priced.

I am also one who grew up Atari/Nintendo and still own this title on my 8-bit NES and this game pays true homage to the way it was. The retro sound is awesome, and they even kept the retro controls although I have finally adapted to the newer controls with the right-clicking; but they are not mandatory, the controls of old are still there, just not in the NES format to a T...just slightly modified but work the same. The retro graphics look a little off to me, but then again, we are in the day of 1080p-4K and there is only so much you can do to make it look good, yet old. So props to the developer for a great job on both aspects.

I still love to play the original and my Shadowgate 64 every couple of years to keep my wits about me and it never gets old. I hope they go to the newer edition from here, but if not, I cannot justify any negativity for the game this is and I am proud for how this turned out in the end.

This is a must-own title. Especially if you want to test yourself to your wits end...

author: {'steamid': '76561197995103405', 'num_games_owned': 460, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1126, 'last_played': 1418258401}

author: {'steamid': '76561198069672424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1410723984}
review:
[h1]Shadowgate - Gutes und Schlechtes[/h1]

Hinsichtlich dieses Spiels halten sich Positives und Negatives die Waage, doch eines vorweg:
Dieses Spiel ist nur etwas für [b]Knobelfreunde[/b].

Positives:
[list]
 [*]Grafisch überzeugt Shadowgate vor allem mit einem Reichtum an Details - große, konturlose Flächen wird man hier     
     vergebens suchen.
[*] Auch die Story lohnt sich (so viel sei verraten), auch wenn ich aus Spoilergründen nicht näher darauf eingehen werde.
[/list]

Negatives:
[list]
[*]Fortschritt erreicht man als völliger Neuling in diesem Spiel nur durch trockenes, frustrierendes Try and Error, mit     
   häufigem Speichern und Anfangs unter Zeitdruck. Ich möchte damit nicht sagen, dass Leute, die dieses Spiel noch
   nie gespielt haben, die Finger davon lassen sollen - wer aber auf schnellen Erfolg aus ist. wird ihn hier nicht finden.

Im Gesamtergebnis gibt es [b]in diesem Spiel einiges zu erleben und entdecken[/b]. Auch die falschen Wege sind oft belustigend und auch die [b]Grafik ist nicht zu verachten.[/b] Trotzdem sollte man auch eine ordentliche Packung Durchhaltevermögen mitbringen - ich kann mich nur wiederhohlen - [b]schnellen Fortschritt gibt es als Unerfahrener hier nicht.[/b]
Ansonsten klare Kaufempfehlung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003580729', 'num_games_owned': 649, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1649897202}
review: I loved Shadowgate on the NES and I even go back to play it from time to time. This game reminds me of all the reasons why I loved the Shadowgate with the puzzles being just as challanging as I remember them.  I highly suggest you pick up this game if you are a fan of puzzles or point/click games because its a great story and a challanging game(very trying) game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967047977', 'num_games_owned': 568, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1490573487}
review: I remember playing the original Shadowgate on both Mac and NES. This reimagining is beautiful and isn't just a graphical update with the original flowchart of the game at all. The story has been expanded, the music and graphics reimagined and the UI has been completely overhauled. I love the new UI, though at times it does feel a bit slow; it isn't choppy or cumbersome, it just seems to slow you down a bit, but it's only a minor annoyance. I love this game so far and I really hope that Zojoi gives the same treatment to Deja Vu, Deja Vu II and Uninvited, a reimagining of Beyond Shadowgate would actually be quite appreciated too. It's nice to see such a modern and beautiful reimagining of these enjoyable games that I grew up with.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975900611', 'num_games_owned': 785, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1649654456}
review: Great take on the classic adventure game.  New twists and puzzles have been added making this one of the trickiest adventure games I've played in a LONG time.  There are a few new elements to this game (such as a curse) which are poorly documented and confusing, but all-in-all, this is a quality title.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991390726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1622745643}
review:
Shadowgate knowers might be skeptic about this game, as i where, but in fact it really improves upon the original.
The graphics are well painted and beautifuly animated, the notes, sounds and cutscenes almost suck you into that living castle!
There are different difficulties which build up on each other, which is nice for the ones who are new to the franchise.
The Soundtrack is a blast! Love it!

Two things which disturbed me a bit: 
1. Sometimes it takes a few seconds to load the next screen if you rush through sections, thats no neck breaker, but it takes out some of the flow. 


2. If you activate the Classic-Mode graphics filter, certain objects are barely noticeable due to pixelation.
If you know the game out of your pocket, thats no problem, but beginners should probably stay away of that mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998752177', 'num_games_owned': 832, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 719, 'last_played': 1447344235}
review:
Dark Souls: Point & Click Edition

Я не сильно люблю квести, тим більше point&click, але ця гра зацікавила. Поглянув на форуми - школярі люто плачуть, кажучи "навіщо такі важкі ігри виускати!?" - значить треба брати. В оригінал не грав (але пограю, бо тепер його додають в комплект до гри), але читав що в людей там пригорало все що могло пригоріти, гра нічого не пояснювала, нічого не підсказувала і не жаліла гравців. І знаєте що? Тут так само. Череп Йорік (привіт, Гамлет) більше насміхається над героєм ніж дає якісь хороші поради. На високому рівні складності можна померти від всього що є навколо і ніхто тебе не попередить , що це неможна, те небажано. Хочеш тикнути в себе ножем - будь ласка, нам то що. Навіть є секретні пасхальні смерті =)

Гра дає вибір - грати в казуальному режимі чи в класичному. В казуальному думати всерівно треба, правда вмирати будете менше та й багато головоломок просто вирізано, тому рекомендую грати в класичному. Класичний ж режим веде нас до ще одного вікна зміни складності - там є вибір між Новачком, Підмайстром і Майстром. І навіть тут є різниця між квестами та методами їх виконання, а також різниця в часових рамках. Ще присутня опція - Залізна Людина. Ні, ви не перетворюєтесь в Тоні Старка. Вибравши цю опцію, вам прийдеться пройти гру без збереженнь.

Графічно гра виконана чудово, всі сценки і предмети намальовані, анімовано в стилі коміксів, інколи є більш активна анімація. Можна міняти стиль графіки від сучасного до ретро (в пікселях). Також є можливість перейти на ретро озвучку, але як на мене то композитор сучасної версії постарався на славу, і 8-бітний саундтрек може порадувати хіба олдфагів. Озвучка голосу оповідача прекрасна, допомагає погрузитися в атмосферу з перших секунд.

Сам геймплей по суті - класичний point&click, лише на відміну від сучасних варіантів - ніхто нічого тобі не підсвічує, ніхто нічого не показує - треба пильно дивитися по сторонах, пропустити важливий предмет легше легкого. Ще є така штука в грі як факели. Тривалість горіння факела залежить від дії та рухів по локаціях. Якщо факел загас - все, пітьма. І хоча вона вас не вбиває і можна чекати вічність (якщо ви звичайно не прокляті :) - будь-який крок - і ви потрапляєте в якусь халепу, що приводить до смерті. Після останніх оновлень, інтерфейс став більш зручним і не загромаджує екран гри. 

Сюжет в цілому не є якимусь видатним - є герой, є наставник, є велике зло. По ходу гри на очі потрапляють книги, листи та записки з яких можна дізнатися про світ. В цілому це читати цікаво. Правда є одне "НО" - локалізації немає і якщо ви не знаєте англійської - то вам буде нецікаво і безмежно важко. Бо знати, що від тебе хочуть важливо, життєво важливо. Хоча це скоріше недолік не гри, а ваш - знання мови ніколи не буде лишнім =)

В заключення хочу сказати - однозначний маст хев. 10 з 10. Шедевр. Навіть якщо ви не любите квестів, але любите челендж в грі - ця гра для вас. Ця гра заставить вас помучатись, провисіти на деяких моментах годинами, а іколи і перепройти заново через запороті моменти або несвоєчасно виконані дії (у випадку якщо ви не робите збереженнь часто). Не рекомендується людям, які чекають від гри піу-піу-піу, або "Press X to win"

I do not know if it will fancy newcomers but it will please those who played the original... or heard about it. If you are into old "click" adventure games, I advise you to give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061042984', 'num_games_owned': 1445, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1475983335}
review: A relic from the past has been redone and much to my liking.  I love the feel of the new game.  A must in my opinion, buy the Special Edition, it truly adds some charm to be able play the old games.  I only wish they would have put out the NES version of the game with the Apple version as well, but hey I will take what I can get.  This is a complete overhaul of the original classic and let me tell ya, they did a great job to keep us old fans interested. At first I had some challenges figuring out the controls, all of which are explained, but still need some playing with to figure out. The redone visuals are amazing and kept the ambience as I remembered from the original, but add so much more.  I find myself enjoyind the new content as much as the original.  Good job recreating a very fond memory, now lets see what your next project brings us!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993356445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 901, 'last_played': 1450389137}
review:
Excellent job at a remake!

The visuals are amazing. Every single scene is a thing of beauty. And for veterans - it will challenge your memory; almost every puzzle has been changed up to give you a fresh experience. And the story has been MASSIVELY expanded, it definitely is worth a look if you're a fan.

Soundtrack is great, and if you're a fan of the NES soundtrack, it's also included and easily toggled on and off. A nice touch!

author: {'steamid': '76561197965322630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1419500098}
review: The best version of Shadowgate I've ever seen and played! Great job!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972452370', 'num_games_owned': 615, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1414691985}
review:
Pros:

+A remake of the classic 1987 Shadowgate, but doesn't feel phoned in or a simple cash grab. The game is faithful to the original, but expands greatly upon it.
+Fans of the original (and later re-releases, including the popular NES version) will absolutely love the option to choose either the new transitions and music or the original 1987 music and transitions.
+The new music pieces are not simply remixes of the original pieces, but rather hauntingly-beautiful retellings.
+Game difficulty determines how hard and how long the game is. A puzzle that requires backtracking or multiple steps on Hard will either be simplified or outright removed on Easy.
+The game's many causes of death reinforces the idea that you don't need your hand held to have fun.

Cons:

-Whoever thought of the idea for retro graphics mode needs to be fired. The "retro" option simply places a filter over the screen, pixelating everything. Imagine playing a game that runs at a native 1920x1080, then changing the resolution to 320x200. That's how bad it is. Unlike the transitions and the music, it is in no way faithful to the original game.
-Unlike the original, the game gives you no indication that your torch is about to go out, leading to an untimely and unexpected death. The NES version had its own music piece to warn you when your torch was about to go out.
-Newcomers to the game may be put off by all the trial-and-error they will have to do, as many of the puzzle solutions seem counter-intuitive.

Full disclosure: I backed this game on Kickstarter.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998180632', 'num_games_owned': 2259, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 1432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1432, 'last_played': 1416686475}
review:
Shadowgate was one of those kind of games growing up that expanded my tastes as a gamer back in the NES days, at the time I played it there was very little like it other than the Sierra games like kings quest etc. The game was a puzzle to unravel and navigate and while you would get stumped sometimes, no answer ever felt like it was total off in left field logic answer.

The Redux has plenty to offer a player new and old, but far more for the old. Only people who have played the original get to fully enjoy some of the nods in the redux. How you proceed in the remake has changed greatly from the original and infact what were solutions to problems in the original now kill you in somewhat humorous ways and even offer secret death endings which I greatly enjoyed.

"point and click adventure" is a name that has been slightly tarnished with games that have you find 10 objects on a still screen while a timer ticks down (you know what I am talking about) but shadowgate tells a story and makes you think. Also if you want to just want to enjoy a story theres always guides, so you never feel stuck if you want to just enjoy a tale. I hope to see more of these classic games revived like Deja Vu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018236377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1456895818}
review:
When I was a kid, I played the old Shadowgate a ton on the Gameboy Color. I even kept a notebook, trying to beat the game, because of how hard it is!

I went into this game expecting pure nostalgia and expecting it to be more of the same. To my surprise, it was actually pretty different! If you played the old game, you will recognize a lot of the rooms, but it definitely isn't the same shadowgate I used to play.

Fantastic first person adventure game, worth every cent!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027805815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1418240754}
review:
There was a time in my life where the original Shadowgate on NES consumed all of my attention.  Friends and I would sit in Biology class drawing maps and comparing notes, then spending the evenings on the phone doing the same.  This lasted until the end of the game; it was pretty great. 

Naturally, when I heard that there was a remake of Shadowgate coming to Steam, my curiosity was piqued immediately.  It was easy to worry though that my fondness of the game only existed in the rose colored glasses of nostalgia.  Thankfully, once I got my hands on the remake, I discovered that Shadowgate was in fact a great game and the remake was pretty great in its own right. 

I've never been one much for modern adventure games, but Shadowgate seems to be a shining example of the genre.  Its packed with some great graphics updates and a great score.  The game play proves to be fun too.  I was worried that a point and click style adventure game wouldn't hold my attention.  Since this game has a good story that gets unveiled the further you journey with hints and clues scattered about the castle, it manages to be pretty engrossing.  It's common finding myself coming back to the game sooner than expected just to find out more story.  This is a strong trait for a strong adventure game! 

If my words don't convince you, check out my ongoing Let's Play series of the game over on my youtube channel!  https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLc2ULPOctS7qOot8P3lGOxvEVhy3vfr-S

author: {'steamid': '76561197960524163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1677416392}
review: loved the NES version. had to buy this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998779819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1438717865}
review:
I have to ask myself one question after the trip down Nostalgia Lane: Would I buy the Dark Souls of my childhood for my friends?  The answer is quite simple: I would MAKE them play it, if only to know that they would have known why I keep my NES clean and only one game to be found.  What is said game?  Gold star if you answered Shadowgate.

Remember your lost nightmares, let them haunt your every motion, hear my bone chilling laugh as it eats away at your very expendable soul, Shadowgate is here once more.  It's here to stay...

Well, a dip in the price might be nice.  More incentive to spread the fun.  The fun that comes with the Grim Reaper on speed dial...

[insert dark, bone chilling laugh here]

author: {'steamid': '76561198042197308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1541097215}
review: Diseño artístico muy bueno, música y ambientación perfecta para una clásica aventura de mazmorras. El juego no tiene grandes "animaciones" pero porque no las necesita, con los efectos de luces, la narración y las pequeñas animaciones es más que suficiente. El sistema de controles, con la nueva rueda de comandos que le han añadido, está bien.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987811307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1434135223}
review:
I was thrilled beyond words that this game got a more modern remake. This was (and in my opinion, still is) the Dark Souls of point and click puzzle/adventure type games. Everything about this is beautiful, compared to the NES version of it. Being able to turn all of those old settings back to the originals (transitions, music, etc.) gives it a nostalgic feel for those who've played the older version of this game. For me it brings back fond memories of not knowing what I was doing. (I was very young when I tried to play the NES version of Shadowgate) 

Do I recomment this game? Definitely. It's pretty damn solid compared to a lot of other games out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965485974', 'num_games_owned': 614, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1436143174}
review: I reallllllllllllly want to write a good review, but I can't bring myself to do so. The game isn't fun. I love the big 3 Kemco adventure games (Uninvited, Shadowgate, and Deja Vu) so when I saw this hit the market my nostalgia meter went through the roof. I didn't buy the game expecting a total speed run, but I expected the game to basically be more or less the same with a graphic overhual. Not the case, rooms are totally different, puzzles are different, and setting the game to retro graphics is nothing but a pixelated mess. Save your $20... I wish i had mine back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038977616', 'num_games_owned': 1387, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1414965705}
review:
[b]First playthrough time: 6 hours[/b]

[i]Disclaimer: I have never played the original game and played though this one mostly on easy settings.[/i]

[b]Major Pros:[/b]
Great art
Interesting puzzles of fair difficulty level
Well planned storyline makes sure players never get too far unintentionally ill prepared
New user interaction methods are fast and easy
No clicking around randomly on every room to find everything (clear markers show all visible interactable objects while secrets are hinted at in gameplay and Yorick can help you if you're stuck)
Clever usage of items to solve puzzles

[b]Minor Pros:[/b]
An easy access log is kept of everything the game tells you
Harder modes encourage smart game play with interesting ways to die while easier modes protect inexperienced players
Hints (for those that use them) are helpful without directly telling you what to do

[b]Major Cons:[/b]
Can't use the map to "port" to places you've already been (walking can take a while, especially toward the end of the game)
Message pop up on certain rooms that you have to click on to dismiss or you can't keep walking even if you've seen them before

[b]Minor Cons:[/b]
Spell descriptions are rather vague and result in you trying the spells on everything a lot to figure out what they do
There are some annoying goblins that randomly attack you for no apparent reason, but defeating them is the same every time
More could've been done to flesh out the story

Even on the easier modes I found the game very enjoyable. The art was nice and the puzzles appropriate and complex. Nothing felt forced in the game and I didn't feel like I'd missed anything by not playing the original game. There wasn't anything that particularly stood out about this game above others in the genre, but I felt it was very solid and enjoyable. The only real annoyance was the time it took to get anywhere which could be a little bit of a problem later in the game when the puzzles spanned more space or were more complex to solve.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976187828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1445054639}

author: {'steamid': '76561198078144937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1414033962}
review:
I really hate to give this a NO because I am a fan of the IP, but alas, it can't be avoided.  Here comes the breakdown:

Graphics: Not too bad at all, but any time there is an intense animation on my screen, I get a very noticable framerate drop in the animation itself. The good looking scenery is actually a little bit of a hindrance, because the environment doesn't offer a lot of context clues on items to be picked up or alternate rooms to go into. Everything blends together a little too well.

Sound: AMAZING. Orchestral arrangements of the classic music, decent sound effects.

Controls: The UI is clunky beyond belief. SCUMM worked back in the day, but In the modern era, not so much. Not tweaking the interface (and actually making it worse at times with what changes were made) for the sake of nostalgia is a bad design choice. The inventory system is horrible. Click command. Open inventory. Click on item. Close inventory. Click on environment.

Gameplay: I  remember the old NES version well enough to remember most of the puzzles, but when the devs added in their new content, everything falls apart. They provide little to no context as to what you need to do, and the in-game hint system is a joke. They also put in a "banshee curse" in the beginning section which will eventually kill you, and if you take too long getting through the game and can't complete it in time, you will have to start over from the very beginning. These two elements together ruin it for me.

A good adventure game should make you have an "Ah-HA!" moment when you get to the next section, not cause you to punch a hole through your monitor out of frustration when you hit the next barrier of progression.

Overall score: 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197999864964', 'num_games_owned': 1439, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1413517152}
review: I've never played the original Shadowgate, but I did play the other "Macventures" (Deja Vu and Uninvited) on my Atari ST back in the day. The remake stays true to the style of the games that came before it while still updating it to the expectations of today's generation, both graphically and musically. And even the simplest difficulty level still makes you scratch your head enough to enjoy a good challenge but not overly so. And Zojoi catered to the old school fans by offering a "retro" experience where you can experience the game almost like it was originally through overlays on the game itself. Anyone who fondly remembers these classics should give this one a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989129610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 798, 'last_played': 1413345938}
review:
Shadowgate is a prime example of how to modernize a game right. It has some flaws here and there, but the spirit of the original is alive and well, tough as it ever was, and will thrill puzzle-solving gamers who take the time to enjoy the rich atmosphere and object based puzzles. If you enjoyed the original game in any of it’s incarnations in the late 80s (or even the Gameboy Color version in the late 90s), you simply must get this one. If you enjoy object based puzzles this is easily one of the best games to offer them in recent years and you should also get your hands on it. However, if a game needs to be action based for you to enjoy it, stay the HELL away.

To read my full review, please go to [url]http://redsectorshutdown.blogspot.com/2014/10/shadowgate-2014-pc-review.html[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198105671668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1590173636}
review: LOVE IT!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032706727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2738, 'last_played': 1517980200}
review:
If you like puzzles and thinking and potentially being insanely frustrated (in a good way) by the puzzle this is a great game.
Let's say you don't like that last part that's okay because they are difficulties, and hints (in all difficulties) to help you!
The original was on amiga, Apple2, and NES, but it's not a port, if you played the originals it's a blessing and a curse. (cause your memory works against you in some puzzles but gives you some idea of what to do in others. there are also a lot more puzzles and updates (Think DLC level content) happening all the time) in October a whole new quest is being added included as an update, it's worth the investment to be sure!

PS Hopefully your adventures won't end too soon that'd be sad.....

author: {'steamid': '76561197990505573', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1604456864}
review: This game is a perfect retro feel modern update of an amazing adventure game. This is puzzle gaming at its best.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064056146', 'num_games_owned': 374, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1655440066}
review: This gem here was always a classic for me on the NES. I never owned it myself, but I had friends that had it. When they would ask me what game I want to play, I said Shadowgate. I just fell in love with whole idea of a game like this on the NES. I loved the adventure, the sounds, and some of the best music ever. You knew from your first few steps into the game that every corner could be potential death. So I must say this was so worth buying, I bought it when in beta and was blown away seeing "The Living Castle of the Dead" brought back to life in HD. I've waited for a long time to see if something like this would ever be made again. And if they made an Uninvited version (Maybe DLC?) I'd fall in love all over again, cause that is another beautiful gem I would die for in HD.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028457985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1541979566}
review:
Remakes are a delicate thing, as it is rare for a remake to match the original, especially if the original is considered  a classic. 

Now, I don't know if Shadowgate remake will be considered a classic in the future, but as far remakes go it is in the rare group of remakes, that manage to do things right. It takes the original 8-bit classic, enhances it, changes some things and comes out as a solid game of its own, which at the same time honors what Shadowgate originally was: dificult, mesmerizing, entharlling and above all, fun, despite it can be pretty unforgiving as far mistakes go.

And the game is pretty and has pretty great soundtrack as well, so it's well worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982097550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1410658143}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027547845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1431807020}
review:
The nostalgia trip from playing this game is immense.

While it is not the Shadowgate you remember 100%, it is nevertheless very similar, with almost all of its iconic puzzles there, even if in a slightly altered form to make you think them out once again. The hand drawn screens are absolutely gorgeous, and while it is possible to play with the classic NES OST, the new and reworked soundtrack made for this remake is pretty neat, too. All the classic tunes are there and can be recognized if you have an acute ear.

Something new to this game, however, is voice acting and cutscenes. While the cutscenes are a novelty and the voice acting is not anything to write home about, they do the job of framing the plot of the game well, explaining why you have come to Shadowgate and why the Warlock Lord needs to be stopped.

Overall, a proved labor of love from the guys at Zojoi. If you are a nostalgic fan of Shadowgate, you should give this remake a try.

Of special note is that the end of the game contains a sequel hook. While Beyond Shadowgate is not known by many, and not even close in quality to the original, I have to say that I am willing to give it a try if Zojoi indeed plans to release it sometime in 2016. The nostalgia may just be enough to justify it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109436185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 960, 'last_played': 1410727360}
review: This is a wonderful remastering of an amazing old-school game! To the non-nostalgic heart, it may be fairly crude, but for those who remember the NES version, this is a must have! Each difficulty includes a completely different set of puzzles. Game is shareable on steamshare. I'm 110 hours in so far between two steam accounts, and I still haven't figured out the last difficulty... I'm not very quick at these thigs but entertainment per price is high in returns.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961258726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1411493206}
review:
This used to be my one of my favorite NES games back in the days and I have been waiting for a worthy remake of this game longer than I can remember.
And did they deliver? Hell yes! The nostalgia of the old music/puzzles/rooms mixed with the new and updated content just makes this game absolutely brilliant.
The only "negative" (or is it really a negative thing?) side of the game I have to say is the level of difficulty in some places, I haven't used a game guide since childhood and I kind of felt bad for using one now. But hey, using a guide kind of brings some nostalgia as well.

Now hurry up and remake Deja Vu and Uninvited dammit!
