author: {'steamid': '76561197966523752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1556253969}
review: Oh the memories... hits you right in the feels

author: {'steamid': '76561197970981111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1702446288}
review:
Shadowgate hearkens back to the classic point and click adventures from the days of early computer gaming.  You start off with just a nudge out the door, a torch and a dirk and are charged with the quest of vanquishing evil in the living castle of Shadowgate.

The game is loaded with puzzles, traps, and head-scratching moments depending on your chosen difficulty.  Having said that, I distinctly remember the NES version being far easier.  Perhaps the hardest difficulty wasn't the best idea...

The menu options are pretty much the same as they were, but the full-screen approach to the UI is a nice change away from the classic version.  You get to see far more of the environment and the amount of detail that went into the hand-painted imagery.

As I delve further and further into the game, I find some of the puzzles famliar but often with new twists (also thanks to the difficulty).  It's tough, at times, and potentiallly frustrating as all good puzzle games should be.

The music is atmospheric and adaptive, laced with familiar nostalgic themes from the classic. The artwork is nice and crisp and the added storyline so far makes it far more immersive than its original form.

For exta nostalgia, they have options to utilize some of the classic NES features such as the music and room transitions.

I would recommend it to fans of the original and fans of point-and-click adventures (like Myst and its ilk).  Beyond that, if you don't like this genre of game, Shadowgate doesn't really offer anything outside of what's safely within the niche of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040144747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1586915339}
review: I loved shadowgate as a kid. I had it on the Nes and played it for hours. This game got me into playing dungeons and dragons. Now with hundreads of hours of D&D under my belt I can say that this game is kinda like playing 1.0 tomb of horrors solo. Or if darksouls had a point and click. Yeah don't stick your hand in the dark hole it will make your arm disintigrate. If you like classic dungeon crawl that makes you think rather then just hit stuff with a big stick here you go this one is well worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970487939', 'num_games_owned': 1791, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1408662920}
review:
A remake of the original game from the Nes, Shadowgate is a  click and point adventures that follows the original retro style redone  with voice acting, animated graphics, and the complicated puzzles changed up to blow your mind in fustration but full of satisfactory when solved. Fans of the original Shadowgate will love the remake of this game and the feeling of retro nostalgia.

The game starts with an animated opening accompanied by a  great soundtrack and voice narration that will give you the immersion and overhwelming feeling of  epicness to your adventure to conquer the castle and stop an evil warlock. 

Though not everything is voiced in the game except for major plotline cutscenes for the story. The game still does a great job with the  text dialogue. The graphics will remind you of a really well done animated  graphic novel if you've ever experienced any of those. The gameplay itself a click adventure puzzle game and might not be everyone's cup of tea.

Upon playing the game and starting off your adventure you'll be greeted with 3 different difficulty mode to the game, each of which changes up the solution to the puzzles to the game and stop players from thinking they know the puzzles after playing the first time. Along with starting the adventure you'll be given a well detailed tutorial that explains how the mechanics, and how the game works. This isn't your usual point and click adventure but a retro gameplay style with the player having to use hotkeys and clicking on top for buttons to execute commands such as use, speak, or even to open doors and move forward etc. So an example is  in order to get in through a door to the next area  to progress you'll have to first open the door or you'll run headlfirst into it.

The game will feature puzzles that are pretty complex and feels VERY satisfying when you actually solve it. The game does give you hints hidden in well written riddles and text on spells, items, and scroll you find in order to progress.  Upon being stuck however, players  do have the ability to talk to your only sidekick skull partner Yorick who at times talk alot but does give you hints also in riddles  but unless you paid attention to certain surrondings and the riddles, you'll be stuck at certain areas for quite a bit. 
The way to solve certain situations sometimes is trial and error sometimes and  be warned however that making a mistake at certain locations and it's death for you in many ways. There are creatures in this castle to stop you along the way such as krakens and dragons.  Luckily the game does offer saving and  quicksave to keep on playing. To add on to this the game has a mechanic that everything you do is considered a move except for looking. So each time you are using a move your torch is slowly diminishing. If you run out of torches you'll have no choice but to restart a previous save becuase leaving  will make you fall in the dark and break your neck. Along with the torch there will be another element later in the game that will be more brutal on you forcing you to quicken your pace a bit.

The one thing about the game is when you do die you'll die in a gruesome way. Along with death flying along and giving you a speech about your misery sometimes in a humorous manner. So try not to die and do your best at the puzzles, Read, look, and tread carefully in this castle of doom.

+ Animated graphics 
+ Well written dialogue 
+ Voice over and cutscenes are nicely done
+ Immersive Music
+ Complex puzzle with 3 different difficulty and change up
+ includes retro voice, music, and audio from the nes version that you can switch to


- When you get stuck its pretty brutal don't give up
- The retrostyle interface might not be everyones thing
- The only downside is once you know the solutions then thats pretty much it for the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035449580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1589960976}
review: Hours of my life were gloriously spent playing this game on NES back in the day, and I am sooooo happy to see it here on Steam. I've played it in Beta mode and it was a challenge that I loved.  I can't thank Zojoi enough for their excellent remastering of Shadowgate.  I love everything about the remake, and I highly recommend it to all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002734128', 'num_games_owned': 3358, 'num_reviews': 928, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1581373461}
review:
This is truly an excellent callback to the original Shadowgate from 1987 for the NES (which I owned).  The art is fantastic first and foremost, with the UI being relatively easy to navigate.  While the rooms have a similar look to their 1987 counterparts, the puzzles have been changed slightly.  To top that off, there are three difficulties that change how quickly the torches run out, the frequency/difficulty of puzzles, and etc.  There's also a retro mode, allowing you to listen to the old music and experience the transitions we've come to know and love.  A hint system exists to help you somewhat, though it won't give you the answer flat out like BTTF: The Game did.  

Bottom line: if you're a retro-gamer like myself, you owe it to yourself to pick this up.  Well done, devs!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gC3ooKFa96M

author: {'steamid': '76561198150840072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1589391936}
review: Stupendo... Grafica magistralmente disegnata e gameplay pazzurdo... Lo consiglio assolutamente... ai più pazienti ovviamente.... Sono morto due volte nel giro di 20 min!!! LOL

author: {'steamid': '76561198024945473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1410908337}
review: This game brings back so many old memories back from the NES days, Shadowgate was one of my favourites on that console. I`m pleased to see that Zojoi have bringed back the game in every possible way. The graphics is beautiful handrawn, and the music suits the gameplay very well. I think it`s great that the developer has used the old tunes, and improved on it with a more orchestral sound. They have not only remade the game, but they have also improved the puzzles in the game. Many of the puzzles are tweaked from the orginal, but at the same time they stay true to the original game. The game is also much larger than the orginal. Zojoi has been able to squeeze everything they intended, but could not do to because of memory limitations on the NES version into this version. This is Shadowgate how they visualised it to be all those years ago, packed into a modern upgraded version. There is just one word that concludes everything i have said, and that is AWESOME!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999733303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1488062182}
review:
I've been waiting for this remake my entire adult life. I spent many an evening with a group of friends doing speed runs of the NES version for shots, those were the times.

I'm loving what I've played thus far. The art and music presentation are top notch. I was a little on the fence about the UI based on production stills during development but it's fluid and classic. The retro options are a nice touch to give us some nostalgia.

If you've mastered any of the previous versions do yourself a favor and jump right in on the hardest difficulty. Things may seem familiar, but you'll bare witness to the Reaper far more than you thought you would.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043878299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1406, 'last_played': 1412994351}
review:
All the nostalgia you'd expect -- All the new trials and challenge you wouldn't.

For the fence sitters of this reimagining of Shadowgate:  To shrug this offering of the Shadowgate franchise as simply a remake does the efforts of the development team no justice.

For those who have played any of the previous versions of the game across its many iterations, you will indeed feel as though you have returned to the same castle, and the same aura of the game remains surprisingly intact and pervades each and every room.

But be warned, the familiarity is both friend and foe as you begin to traverse the new puzzles and challenges.  Old riddles may not always be what they seem and familiarity can lend itself to misdirection.  It will take a fresh perspective from the player to prepare for the fresh traps, trials, and tribulations of this new castle shaped the guise of the old.

I must admit I had a skeptical approach to the title myself before being part of its testing; but have been pleasantly surprised by the respect to the original and the careful balance of nostalgia vs new content paid by the development team.

If you enjoyed the previous generations of the Living Castle, Shadowgate, then you will most certainly find quite a lot to love about its newest incarnation.  And if you are new to this genre of gameplay or this franchise, then Shadowgate is an apt place to start.

So if you're still interested: grab a torch, a weapon of choice, and pluck up a touch of courage and take on the new challenge of the newest Castle Shadowgate -- the Reaper is waiting to see just where your adventure may chance to end...and he can wait far longer than you can.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972709566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1552698518}
review: Simply put: if you played this as a child back in the 80's, you owe it to yourself to purchase this remake.  It's an excellent, and challenging, standalone point-and-click adventure game, perfectly seasoned with nostalgia to make you smile.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969391402', 'num_games_owned': 2131, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 965, 'last_played': 1420545330}
review:
A classic reborn.  If you loved the computer and NES origins of this game, you absolutely have to pick this up.  The puzzles and music are classig enough to bring every bit of emotional response you want in nostalgia and so much updating and redesign that it feels current and new again.

Some classic puzzles are still there, some classic puzzles are not what you thought they would be, and tons of nods to classic scenarios that have been removed.  The new puzzles are fresh, complex and satisfying to solve.  

Being able to toggle retro music was a blast.  Some of my favorite video game music was from this and Rich Douglas did a magnificent job translating those songs to current times.  The sounds and music were perfectly done to match all the new visuals and puzzles.  

If you have never played Shadowgate before, and you love point and click adventure titles, or puzzle solving adventures a la Myst, 11th Hour, 7th Guest, etc... you would have a blast with this.   Can't wait to see them redo Uninvited and Deja Vu!

author: {'steamid': '76561197987216603', 'num_games_owned': 988, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1220, 'last_played': 1634149337}
review: If Shadowgate is the last game I get to play in this life, I'll die happy...

author: {'steamid': '76561198035708886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1408275099}
review:
This is a great old-school style adventure game. It doesn't hold your hand but leaves you with a sense of accomplishment when something clicks. Shadowgate has an eerie ambiance and really evokes feelings of isolation and wonder. It also has a very underrated soundtrack.

P.S. You should buy it so Zojoi will reboot Uninvited and Déjà vu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021896174', 'num_games_owned': 1066, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1452632862}
review:
being a fan from the old days of win3.1 and nes, i was looking forward for this game; i had doubts about how they will pull it off, being a fan and a gamer who played it many times, i was worried the puzzles would be far too similar and the game easy to beat. I WAS WRONG, this game is like a reboot with so many new things and new locations but with some key elements left intact.
Make no mistake, i still prefer the nes original and thank Goodness they gave us the ability to switch to 8 bit soundtrack since the new one is just too epic sometimes and makes u forget this is shadowgate so a bit of nostalgia is good.
the game looks amazing, it controls well and the music is brilliant, they pulled it off, they made a worthy remake and now if only they make more games like beyond shadowgate or even a new one with fps gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071922964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1025, 'last_played': 1633551972}
review:
Du pur bonheur, un grand merci à Zoiji d'avoir revisité ce jeu mythique.
Malgré ce qu'on pourrait croire, il est bien plus difficile que sa version NES que je connais quasi par coeur.
Beta testeur, et pourtant souvent bloqué pendant des heures, voire des jours entiers et j'en suis toujours pas venu à bout à cette heure.
Vraiment un bon investissement à faire si vous le voulez, pour passer des heures de folie.
Seul point négatif pour l'instant, le jeu est uniquement en anglais. J'espère que la version définitive sera proposée en plusieurs langues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040610649', 'num_games_owned': 1448, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1533529621}
review: This game is absolutely amazing. Whether you played the original or not, this game still brings the same level of difficulty. People who played the original, that know all the puzzles, will be faced with an entirely new look on the game. Puzzles are altered and made far more interesting while still keeping to the true Shadowgate experience. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197993373430', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1693802244}
review:
Now that the game is fully out I continue to love it.  Looks like they cleaned up some graphic points and some more sound effects were added for when you solve puzzles and such.  Since I beta tested this game I got mentioned in the credits (Awesome!).

If you liked the classic NES game or the old school computer version then you will absolutely love this new remake.  They didn't take away from the original game at all.  All the confusing puzzles and they "what do I do now?" moments are still there......TRUST ME!.  There are some new things in there and a puzzles change around when you play on a different difficulty level.  A extensive stoy line has been added in and I feel it gives the game more depth and really gets you into the adventure.  If you want a real challange true to the game's true nature then play on Master mode.  If you like deep dark adventures where a challange is invovled then you will like this game.  Good luck to all the young Jairs out there!

author: {'steamid': '76561198146218115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2577, 'last_played': 1692213418}
review:
Like other gamers, I am sometimes hesitant in seeing a remake of a wonderful classic especially one that stuck to me as a child. Ever since I played this game on a NES system a few decades ago, I recall all the frustration I had when going through some tedious puzzles, yet the joy when solving a problem made it more the worthwhile.

Those who have played the game will likely recall a skull ornament door at the very start of the game. Once inside, the warlock lord makes his first appearance (his eyes anyway) dismissing your quest to stop him and confidently remarks about your imminent death. Alas your journey and the puzzles start immediately. At times you attempt to methodically evaluate and make sense of a problem ahead. In other times, you may resort to trying random actions. Actions which may cause you to progress, cause your death – or even witty remarks to things you wouldn’t do in real life!

Its 2014, a remake of Shadowgate arrives. I really didn’t know what to anticipate until the game started. Unlike the previous game, this remake has three different modes with master being the most difficult. After choosing a difficulty mode, I was met with a familiar setting to the original classic. There was an air of nostalgia in the opening sequence, yet it was original and fresh - the design was fabulous. The background music was nicely adapted from the classic Shadowgate. A nice feature of the game is to switch the soundtracks to the original MIDI composition! A major difference at the start is you are met with a companion named Yorick, who not only guides you through your quest, but throws a few jokes and remarks to put you at ease in some frustrating situations. This was all before I entered the door - from here on I just knew this was going to be a master piece of a game. Boy was I right! The art work for the cut scenes later on were simply fantastic and suited well the nature of this point-and-click adventure game. The puzzles were similar to the classic though with more mind-boggling twist. They were that much better to solve. I couldn’t put the game down and even today, decades later, with the similarities from the previous game, the frustrations still arose. There are also a variety of side ‘missions’ for further achievements. With this in mind, this game is repayable, addicting and fun.

Zojoi takes the great problem solving of the original game to a whole new level.

[b][h1]A superb game 5/5[/h1][/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197996907557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1464906776}
review: Great update on the classic point and click adventure game.  Enough is changed to still have you scratching your head even if you've mastered the classic game's puzzles.  If you were a fan of the original, then you will surely love this tribute.

review: In the 80s This game made me hate my life. Great game. Very challenging. The love and care that was taken to bring this game back to its fans is amazing. they added hotkeys so puzzle solving is MUCH quicker....If you can even solve them. XD Great story cool art work and all the origional music! A Must see....

author: {'steamid': '76561198001704814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1663697634}
review: I'm a huge fan of the old Shadowgate, Uninvited, and Deja Vu. I have even played , beat and own Shadowgate 64 and Beyond Shadowgate for Turbo Grafix 16 CD. Point and Click games are among my favourite genre of games, and I can say this game is great. If you have played Shadowgate before, pick this one up as it feels like a totally new experience. You won't be dissapointed if you are a fan of these games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970743693', 'num_games_owned': 1057, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1776, 'last_played': 1409292269}
review:
I am a veteran of the original Shadowgate which I played many years ago as a young boy on the Amiga 500. I was content at the fact Zojoi were reimaging the game with new hand drawn rooms and music, but to my surprise, what the developers have actually done is taken Shadowgate to a whole new level.

If you thought you knew how to conquer Shadowgate, think again. It is still the same nostalgic Shadowgate you once knew, with the same thematic puzzles, though now with a modern twist and level of complexity requiring a greater level of thinking and problem solving. Zojoi have also expanded Castle Shadowgate to introduce new areas of the game that were not accessbile or included in the original. The Steam achievement are also nice touch. Curing the curse in under 200 turns was a challanging achievement.

If you are not a thinker or problem solver then this game may not be for you. If you do get stuck (and you will) take a break to think about the puzzles. If you are still stuck the forum is very active and helpful, often providing you clues to solve the puzzles without actually providing you the spoiler.

Words cannot describe the feelings I get playing this. No modern game has kept me this entertained. At the price Zojoi are offering this, it is a steal!

Re-experience the mystery of Castle Shadowgate!

author: {'steamid': '76561198142443085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1427671858}
review: Awesome is the word to describe this thinking man's game. Highly detailed, hand-drawn art work that comes to life on-screen. Stays very true to the old format while adding new twists and surprises. The music and sound effects are amazing and immerse you in the experience. The addition of how light effects your play through is an added challenge. The storytelling aspect of the voice overs as well as playing through the different rooms is of the highest imaginative quality. Overall very pleased that the makers of Shadowgate have given longtime fans as well as newcomers the chance to relive the magic.... of Castle Shadowgate.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139815184', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1558813733}
review: Excellent game so far! Challenging and PAINFULLY difficult in places ... but loving it! Definitely highly recommended!
